text: Check if the sold article has a cost price and a sales price. If not, this has to be changed to at least 0.01 for both or it won't be displayed in the system.
title: Sale not transferred to stock
description: Check if the sold article has a cost price and a sales price. If not, this has to be changed to at least 0.01 for both or it won't be displayed in the system.

text: To add a new supplier: 1. Log into Backoffice 2. Choose Suppliers 3. Click Create Supplier 4. Fill in at the very least Supplier No. and Name 5. Set currency if it is different from what is already listed 6. Click create
title: Suppliers - add to BO
description:
To add a new supplier:


1. Log into Backoffice


2. Choose Suppliers


3. Click Create Supplier


4. Fill in at the very least Supplier No. and Name


5. Set currency if it is different from what is already listed


6. Click create

text: If the website is showing as a blank white site, you need to update the URL as well as the bookmark in the browser. Update the link with: dddbackoffice.com Make sure the customer doesn't have an old link lying around
title: DDD backoffice is showing as a blank white page
description:
If the website is showing as a blank white site, you need to update the URL as well as the bookmark in the browser. 


Update the link with: 


dddbackoffice.com


Make sure the customer doesn't have an old link lying around

text: Issue: The client number must be the same as the shop number. (i.e. 500001 is shop number 1 for itemtransfer and inventory) This is not always the case, since some franchise clients fx have a number like 500502. Since the system only handles 2 digits shop numbers for itemtransfer and inventory, the client number and the shop number sometimes could be different. When a shop is set up for transfer in admin, the shop name is appended to POSConfig>StoreTransfer. There is a check on the first 20 characters. The shop name is written to POS>Stores and the shop number is set to the shop number stated in the file “butikker.$$$”. I.e. the shop number does not have to be the same as the client number anymore. The shop number can be set in DdD supporttool. It is still highly recommended, that the client number and the shopnumber, as far as possible, are the same.
title: Client/Shopnumber
description:
Issue: The client number must be the same as the shop number. (i.e. 500001 is shop number 1 for itemtransfer and inventory)

This is not always the case, since some franchise clients fx have a number like 500502. Since the system only handles 2 digits shop numbers for itemtransfer and inventory, the client number and the shop number sometimes could be different.

When a shop is set up for transfer in admin, the shop name is appended to POSConfig>StoreTransfer. There is a check on the first 20 characters. The shop name is written to POS>Stores and the shop number is set to the shop number stated in the file “butikker.$$$”.

I.e. the shop number does not have to be the same as the client number anymore. The shop number can be set in DdD supporttool.

It is still highly recommended, that the client number and the shopnumber, as far as possible, are the same.

text: Every year,the tax laws are regulated and most of the time the vat percentage is increased. In order to meet the sales data,the VAT value must be updated in backoffice as desired in order to make the transactions/sales compatiable with the new VAT rate. The task needs to be done by the customer itself as shown in the below screenshot. In case of changes to take effect on all concerning POS'es ,a scrift needs to be sent to all POS'es in question by the drift for that specific date. 1-Login to backoffice 2-Go to Maintenance 3-Select Moms 4-Change VAT according to the requirement. 5-Finally,Click on update.
title: Changing tax/VAT in backoffice.
description:
Every year,the tax laws are regulated and most of the time the vat percentage is increased.

In order to meet the sales data,the VAT value must be updated in backoffice as desired in order to make the transactions/sales compatiable with the new VAT rate.

The task needs to be done by the customer itself as shown in the below screenshot.

In case of changes to take effect on all concerning POS'es ,a scrift needs to be sent to all POS'es in question by the drift for that specific date.

1-Login to backoffice
2-Go to Maintenance
3-Select Moms
4-Change VAT according to the requirement.
5-Finally,Click on update.

text: In case a button is not responsive while at the DDD backoffice login screen, usually it is a windows/browser scaling bug. The solution is to change the zoom of the browser window. Usually to 90% When this has been done, the buttons are most likely responsive again.
title: Login/ok button not working
description:
In case a button is not responsive while at the DDD backoffice login screen, usually it is a windows/browser scaling bug. 



The solution is to change the zoom of the browser window. Usually to 90%



When this has been done, the buttons are most likely responsive again.

text: Turn off the scanner first Press 7 + 9 + Powerbutton This gives access to the setup menu. Choose Settings (press blue button to accept) Choose 1. Clock Enter the date backwards 23 - 08 - 22 (year - month - day) and then the time Accept
title: Change date/time on inventory scanner
description:
Turn off the scanner first

Press 7 + 9 + Powerbutton


This gives access to the setup menu.


Choose Settings (press blue button to accept)


Choose 1. Clock


Enter the date backwards 23 - 08 - 22 (year - month - day) and then the time


Accept

text: 1. Press 8 and the power button to start up 2. Choose 2 Activate 3. Choose language 4. Choose Esc
title: Change language on inventory scanner
description:
1. 1.    Press 8 and the power button to start up 

  

  1. 2.    Choose 2 Activate 

  

  1. 3.    Choose language 

  

  1. 4.    Choose Esc

text: The scanner could be connected to the wrong port. The scanner (cradle) has to be connected to Com7. If they have removed the cradle between inventories, it is possible that Windows has assigned a new port to the scanner. Open Computer Management to check where it's connected. Change the port if it has a different number. To be sure that the ComPort ist the right one, it should be saying "COM7 enabled" in the Starlight Communicator.
title: Inventory scanner is not working
description:
The scanner could be connected to the wrong port.

  

The scanner (cradle) has to be connected to Com7. If they have removed the cradle between inventories, it is possible that Windows has assigned a new port to the scanner. 

  

Open Computer Management to check where it's connected. Change the port if it has a different number. 

To be sure that the ComPort ist the right one, it should be saying "COM7 enabled" in the Starlight Communicator.

text: 1. Choose 2 Vareflyt (Item transfer) instead of 1 Inventory (Status) on the scanner 2. Choose which store the items are from and which store they should be transfered to 3. Scan like with inventory on the POS you are sending from 4. Transfer the files to the POS 5. Send them to BO Wait 10-15 minutes and the transfer item file should turn up on the POS.
title: Item transfer to a different stock
description:
1. 1.    Choose 2 Vareflyt (Item transfer) instead of 1 Inventory (Status) on the scanner 

  

  1. 2.    Choose which store the items are from and which store they should be transfered to 

  

  1. 3.    Scan like with inventory on the POS you are sending from 
      

  1. 4.    Transfer the files to the POS 
      

  1. 5.    Send them to BO 


Wait 10-15 minutes and the transfer item file should turn up on the POS.

text: If the client wants to know if they have scanned all locations, there is nothing we can do until they have emptied the scanner and received an overview of the scanner locations. If a location is missing, they have to rescan that specific location and transfer it again. Attention!!! They should not rescan just to be safe. If they have scanned it and just can't remember and repeat the scan, they will double the numbers of the scanned items.
title: Lost location
description:
If the client wants to know if they have scanned all locations, there is nothing we can do until they have emptied the scanner and received an overview of the scanner locations. 

  

If a location is missing, they have to rescan that specific location and transfer it again. 

  

Attention!!! They should not rescan just to be safe. If they have scanned it and just can't remember and repeat the scan, they will double the numbers of the scanned items.

text: If they want to scan more items of the same kind (e.g. plastic bags), choose number first and then scan them.
title: Multible Items (scan several of the same item)
description: If they want to scan more items of the same kind (e.g. plastic bags), choose number first and then scan them.

text: Rental scanner per week: 1,050.00 Dkk plus freight
title: Prices
description: Rental scanner per week: 1,050.00 Dkk plus freight

text: The shop number in the inventory scanner are the last 3 digits of the client id. This can usually be found by checking in TeamViewer or Backoffice Support Tools.
title: Shop number
description: The shop number in the inventory scanner are the last 3 digits of the client id. This can usually be found by checking in TeamViewer or Backoffice Support Tools.

text: If the file from the scanner has been transfered, but option 3 states there is no file to transfer to BO, then check if the input.dat file has been renamed to termdata.asc. If not, rename it manually. That should work.
title: Transfer data from scanner to PC
description: If the file from the scanner has been transfered, but option 3 states there is no file to transfer to BO, then check if the input.dat file has been renamed to termdata.asc. If not, rename it manually. That should work.

text: If the inventory scanner is stuck in the program manager tell the customer to choose "Activate"->"One program" and then the according program/language. If no program is shown and the outcome for pressing "Activate memory" is "no program exists", the scanner is missing the program. The program either needs to be uploaded by us or the scanner is defect.
title: Scanner stuck in program manager
description:
If the inventory scanner is stuck in the program manager tell the customer to choose "Activate"->"One program" and then the according program/language.

If no program is shown and the outcome for pressing "Activate memory" is "no program exists", the scanner is missing the program. The program either needs to be uploaded by us or the scanner is defect.

text: Every normal working week day, the checks listed below are done. This is because (@Fahim - why - what's the reason for this, and impact if we don't?) a b Fahim: I have discussed it with Jacob and it was concluded that there are no EDI daily checks involved. Jacob receives an excel file with status report that all the stores have received their sales data or not. In any case,the customer itself also contacts on the same day and inform that which location is missing sales data. According to Jacob,if a store has missed data for today due to some reasons,it should be read out anyway in the next run following the coming night. In case,if a store is missing their sales figures so a ticket needs to be created for it and it should be send to the development team and they can further look into it. ( https://support.k3btg.com/a/solutions/articles/103000295705?lang=en ) Moreover,Jacob has written to Danijela Smaka CBR team to add my email address in the thread and now I am able to receive the daily sales report from CBR. if the errors are related to the missing varegruppe mapping,so the procedure can be followed in the following article. (https://support.k3btg.com/a/solutions/articles/103000283650?lang=en) if a new EDI supplier needs to be operated for a customer,the procedure can be followed in the following article. Helpdesk : K3 Support (freshdesk.com)
title: Introduction to EDI Daily Checks - What and Why
description:
Every normal working week day, the checks listed below are done. This is because (@Fahim - why - what's the reason for this, and impact if we don't?)

  1. a
  2. b



Fahim:
I have discussed it with Jacob and it was concluded that there are no EDI daily checks involved.
Jacob receives an excel file with status report that all the stores have received their sales data or not.
In any case,the customer itself also contacts on the same day and inform that which location is missing sales data.

According to Jacob,if a store has missed data for today due to some reasons,it should be read out anyway in the next run following the coming night.

In case,if a store is missing their sales figures so a ticket needs to be created for it and it should be send to the development team and they can further look into it. ( https://support.k3btg.com/a/solutions/articles/103000295705?lang=en )

Moreover,Jacob has written to Danijela Smaka CBR team to add my email address in the thread and now I am able to receive the daily sales report from CBR.


if the errors are related to the missing varegruppe mapping,so the procedure can be followed in the following article.
(https://support.k3btg.com/a/solutions/articles/103000283650?lang=en)

if a new EDI supplier needs to be operated for a customer,the procedure can be followed in the following article.
Helpdesk : K3 Support (freshdesk.com)

text: In editoolbox,all supported clients can be observed regarding their backoffice error count.These errors can be reduced or vanished proactively before the customer can contact us any query regarding their itemgroups. The following link (requires support username and password) gives access to get an overview of different clients as shown in the screenshot. http://editoolbox.dddretail.com/#/ We can also observe a single client by using the tools option in the above link by entering a specific client id. As in this example,the client id is 295001 for customer BySiW Aabybro which shows backoffice errors with a total number of 20. Every store has a unique GLN(Global Location number-13 digits) which identifies a specific store location and is the first step in communicating via EDI within business. By clicking the backoffice error tab as shown in the below screenshot,different information about the errors are documented which helps in identifying the errors. In this case, we are focusing only on Fejl varegruppe EDI errors which indeed needs mapping of different items groups in EDI tool and DdD backoffice for a specific customer. The number of errors vanishes as soon the item groups are correctly mapped in EDI and DdD backoffice.The error logs can be sent to a specific email where one can get a csv file(we need only csv file with pricat information). After a specific user email is entered,the error log files are being sent to that specific email. Normally,3 files are received with information describing PRICAT,Despatch advice and OrderResponse.Here we will focus only on the file with PRICAT as shown in the below screenshot. The pricat csv is processes with data manipulation and the file shows different information about the supplier,EDI item group number,type of the product,EAN number and the type of error. Column I represents the item group number in EDI that must be match with a specific item number in DdD backoffice. Column K represents the product information and thus column X represents the item EAN code. AC shows the particular supplier for that item and AE shows specific error regarding to that item. In this case the error type is Fejl varegruppe EDI. As we have observed the EDI itemgroup numbers as shown above,the next step is to map them regarding their specific itemgroup in DdD backoffice.If there is no matching a new specific item group can be created and then mapped back with EDI itemgroup number.In such case,the new itemgroup must be communicated with the customer and should be approved by them. As shown in the below screenshot,the item groups are being matched regarding to the product type. 1703 is EDI item group which belongs to the category SkIRT and in backoffice,it can be mapped with itemgroup 72 The mapping table is shared as below. The mapping of these itemgroups according to specific supplier are done in EDI tool by using the following link and requires DdD support tools username and password in order to access the tool. https://editool.dddretail.com/EDI/EDIMainPage.aspx The setup here shows different information about EDI setup for a specific customer and an overview of list of suppliers. Please note that if an itemgroup belongs to one than more supplier,so it must be mapped to all respective suppliers. The supplier b.young is shown in this exampler and we found out from the csv file that there are 4 itemgroups for the supplier b.young. In this case, by selecting b.young,we will create 4 extra rows and enter the particular details as shown in the below image. After clicking on save mapping,the particular mappings are matched and press continue. More mapping can also be done by selecting other suppliers as Cream and Culture. When all mapping is done,we will notice that most of the backoffice errors are resolved or reduced. In order to observe that We can go back again to EDI tools for customer 295001. Click on scheduled Task as shown below and wait for a few seconds. We can observe that the number of errors are now reduced from 20 to 6.
title: EDI Tools-Backoffice errors
description:
In editoolbox,all supported clients can be observed regarding their backoffice error count.These errors can be reduced or vanished proactively before the customer can contact us any query regarding their itemgroups.

The following link (requires support username and password) gives access to get an overview of different clients as shown in the screenshot.

http://editoolbox.dddretail.com/#/


We can also observe a single client by using the tools option in the above link by entering a specific client id.
As in this example,the client id is 295001 for customer BySiW Aabybro which shows backoffice errors with a total number of 20. Every store has a unique GLN(Global Location number-13 digits) which identifies a specific store location and is the first step in communicating via EDI within business.


By clicking the backoffice error tab as shown in the below screenshot,different information about the errors are documented which helps in identifying the errors.

In this case, we are focusing only on Fejl varegruppe EDI errors which indeed needs mapping of different items groups in EDI tool and DdD backoffice for a specific customer.

The number of errors vanishes as soon the item groups are correctly mapped in EDI and DdD backoffice.The error logs can be sent to a specific email where one can get a csv file(we need only csv file with pricat information).



After a specific user email is entered,the error log files are being sent to that specific email.
Normally,3 files are received with information describing PRICAT,Despatch advice and OrderResponse.Here we will focus only on the file with PRICAT as shown in the below screenshot.



The pricat csv is processes with data manipulation and the file shows different information about the supplier,EDI item group number,type of the product,EAN number and the type of error.

Column I represents the item group number in EDI that must be match with a specific item number in DdD backoffice.
Column K represents the product information and thus column X represents the item EAN code.
AC shows the particular supplier for that item and AE shows specific error regarding to that item.
In this case the error type is Fejl varegruppe EDI.




As we have observed the EDI itemgroup numbers as shown above,the next step is to map them regarding their specific itemgroup in DdD backoffice.If there is no matching a new specific item group can be created and then mapped back with EDI itemgroup number.In such case,the new itemgroup must be communicated with the customer and should be approved by them.




As shown in the below screenshot,the item groups are being matched regarding to the product type.
1703 is EDI item group which belongs to the category SkIRT and in backoffice,it can be mapped with itemgroup 72
The mapping table is shared as below.




The mapping of these itemgroups according to specific supplier are done in EDI tool by using the following link and requires DdD support tools username and password in order to access the tool.

https://editool.dddretail.com/EDI/EDIMainPage.aspx

The setup here shows different information about EDI setup for a specific customer and an overview of list of suppliers.
Please note that if an itemgroup belongs to one than more supplier,so it must be mapped to all respective suppliers.




The supplier b.young is shown in this exampler and we found out from the csv file that there are 4 itemgroups for the supplier b.young.

In this case, by selecting b.young,we will create 4 extra rows and enter the particular details as shown in the below image.
After clicking on save mapping,the particular mappings are matched and press continue.



More mapping can also be done by selecting other suppliers as Cream and Culture.

When all mapping is done,we will notice that most of the backoffice errors are resolved or reduced.
In order to observe that We can go back again to EDI tools for customer 295001.

Click on scheduled Task as shown below and wait for a few seconds.

We can observe that the number of errors are now reduced from 20 to 6.

text: Error description Fejl variant = the EAN is unknown, might be missing a pricat. Fejl DESADV før ORDRSP = the DESADV is missing its ORDRSP, maby the ORDRSP has failed Fejl supplier ILN = the GLN number is unknown, maby a partner is not setup. Fejl leverandør = the supplier has not been mapped Fejl varegruppe EDI = the product group is missing its mapping Fejl varegruppe EDI SAT = the product group is missing in backoffice, but the mapping is there
title: EDI-Error details
description:
Error description

Fejl variant = the EAN is unknown, might be missing a pricat.

Fejl DESADV før ORDRSP = the DESADV is missing its ORDRSP, maby the ORDRSP has failed

Fejl supplier ILN = the GLN number is unknown, maby a partner is not setup.

Fejl leverandør = the supplier has not been mapped

Fejl varegruppe EDI = the product group is missing its mapping

Fejl varegruppe EDI SAT = the product group is missing in backoffice, but the mapping is there

text: The customer can contact us that they want to integrate with a new supplier using EDI. Please note that it is a payment task and should go through CSM. After approval from CSM,the process can be started. The procedure is as follows. First of all the new supplier must be operated in DdD backoffice. In this case,We are assuming supplier name Street One with a supplier number 5. We can login to EDI tool using our support login credentials with the following link. editool.dddretail.com/Login.aspx Enter the respective Group number (728 in this case) and then choose EDI type 96A and check for the available clients as shown in the below screenshot. Here,the only active store is 728002. In Order to register new supplier,Click on Insert new EDI Partner and click on Insert new EDI Partner as shown in the below screenshot. The next step is to fill the supplier details and then click on continue.The details required are Supplier GLN number,Tnr and supplier mapping(5) as from backoffice supplier number. The details for supplier Street One with id 3 is entered and make checkboxes for different options as shown below in the screenshot. Then click on Continue and the new supplier is now added to the customer in EDI tools.
title: New supplier integration with EDI
description:
The customer can contact us that they want to integrate with a new supplier using EDI.
Please note that it is a payment task and should go through CSM.
After approval from CSM,the process can be started.

The procedure is as follows.

First of all the new supplier must be operated in DdD backoffice.
In this case,We are assuming supplier name Street One with a supplier number 5.


We can login to EDI tool using our support login credentials with the following link.
editool.dddretail.com/Login.aspx

Enter the respective Group number (728 in this case) and then choose EDI type 96A and check for the available clients as shown in the below screenshot.
Here,the only active store is 728002.



In Order to register new supplier,Click on Insert new EDI Partner and click on Insert new EDI Partner  as shown in the below screenshot.

The next step is to fill the supplier details and then click on continue.The details required are

Supplier GLN number,Tnr and supplier mapping(5) as from backoffice supplier number.



The details for supplier Street One with id 3 is entered and make checkboxes for different options as shown below in the screenshot.




Then click on Continue and the new supplier is now added to the customer in EDI tools.

text: Make sure the sales number are in the BO. If there are no sales number in the BO, check the POS if it is online. When we have sales numbers in the BO, we most likely have received the numbers to late, so the sales numbers will be sent the very next day.

description:
Make sure the sales number are in the BO. If there are no sales number in the BO, check the POS if it is online. When we have

sales numbers in the BO, we most likely have received the numbers to late, so the sales numbers will be sent the very next day.

text: This will show the availability for the different seats for the Watercress Belle, comparing to the total booked for the session, showing all bookings relating to the session. SELECT shdRecNo [Session Rec No.], shdDescription [Session Name], shdDateTime [Session Date & Time], CASE WHEN shdAllowInternet = 1 THEN 'Yes' ELSE 'No' END [Show Online?], savMax0 [Max Seats Available], savInternetMax [Max Seats Available Online], savMax1 [Max For Single_1], savBooked1 [Single_1 Seats Booked], savBlocked1 [Single_1 Seats Blocked], savBlockedWWW1 [Single_1 Seats Blocked Online Only], savMax5 [Max For Single_2], savBooked5 [Single_2 Seats Booked], savBlocked5 [Single_2 Seats Blocked], savBlockedWWW5 [Single_2 Seats Blocked Online Only], [Total Booked For Session], [Booking Refs.] FROM SeatAvailability JOIN SessionHdr on shdRecNo=savShdRecNo JOIN ( SELECT sesshdRecNo, SUM(sesnum) [Total Booked For Session] FROM SessionBkgs GROUP BY sesshdRecNo ) a ON shdRecNo=a.sesshdRecNo JOIN ( SELECT sesshdRecNo, STRING_AGG(sesbkhref, ', ') [Booking Refs.] FROM ( SELECT DISTINCT sesshdRecNo, sesbkhref FROM SessionBkgs ) b GROUP BY sesshdRecNo ) c ON shdRecNo=c.sesshdRecNo where savPlanId=124
title: Watercress Belle Seat Availability - Mid Hants Railway
description:
This will show the availability for the different seats for the Watercress Belle, comparing to the total booked for the session, showing all bookings relating to the session.


SELECT shdRecNo [Session Rec No.], shdDescription [Session Name], shdDateTime [Session Date & Time],
  CASE WHEN shdAllowInternet = 1 THEN 'Yes' ELSE 'No' END [Show Online?],
savMax0 [Max Seats Available], savInternetMax [Max Seats Available Online],
savMax1 [Max For Single_1], savBooked1 [Single_1 Seats Booked], savBlocked1 [Single_1 Seats Blocked],
savBlockedWWW1 [Single_1 Seats Blocked Online Only], savMax5 [Max For Single_2],
savBooked5 [Single_2 Seats Booked], savBlocked5 [Single_2 Seats Blocked],
savBlockedWWW5 [Single_2 Seats Blocked Online Only], [Total Booked For Session], [Booking Refs.]
FROM SeatAvailability
JOIN SessionHdr on shdRecNo=savShdRecNo
JOIN (
  SELECT sesshdRecNo, SUM(sesnum) [Total Booked For Session]
  FROM SessionBkgs
  GROUP BY sesshdRecNo
) a ON shdRecNo=a.sesshdRecNo
JOIN (
  SELECT sesshdRecNo, STRING_AGG(sesbkhref, ', ') [Booking Refs.]
  FROM (
      SELECT DISTINCT sesshdRecNo, sesbkhref FROM SessionBkgs
    ) b
    GROUP BY sesshdRecNo
) c ON shdRecNo=c.sesshdRecNo
where savPlanId=124

text: This will show all the bookings where from the point the customer clicks Pay Now to us receiving confirmation that the customer has paid. Anything more than an hour will cause issues with the design of the system. SELECT itaWebBkgID [Web Booking ID], cusForeNames +' '+ cusSurname [Name], itaDateStamp [Booking Date], CASE WHEN itaPaidStatus = 1 THEN 'Yes' ELSE 'No' END [Paid?], itaPaidDate [Paid Date], itaBkhref [Booking Ref.], pluShortDesc FROM InternetTransactionAudit LEFT JOIN Customer ON itaAccRecNo=cusAccRecNo AND itaCusSeq=cusSeq LEFT JOIN BKGHeader ON itaBkhref=bkhRef LEFT JOIN BKGDetail ON itaBkhref=bkdRef AND itaBkdSeq=bkdSeq LEFT JOIN BarCodes ON bkdBCDId=bcdId LEFT JOIN PriceLookups ON bcdPLURecNo=pluRecNo WHERE DATEDIFF(MINUTE,itaDateStamp,itapaidDate) > 60 AND itaDateStamp > DATEADD(YEAR,-1,GETDATE()) ORDER BY itaDateStamp DESC
title: Internet Bookings Confirmed Hour+ Delay
description:
This will show all the bookings where from the point the customer clicks Pay Now to us receiving confirmation that the customer has paid. Anything more than an hour will cause issues with the design of the system.


SELECT itaWebBkgID [Web Booking ID], cusForeNames +' '+ cusSurname [Name], itaDateStamp [Booking Date],
CASE WHEN itaPaidStatus = 1  THEN 'Yes' ELSE 'No' END [Paid?], itaPaidDate [Paid Date], itaBkhref [Booking Ref.], pluShortDesc FROM InternetTransactionAudit
LEFT JOIN Customer ON itaAccRecNo=cusAccRecNo AND itaCusSeq=cusSeq
LEFT JOIN BKGHeader ON itaBkhref=bkhRef
LEFT JOIN BKGDetail ON itaBkhref=bkdRef AND itaBkdSeq=bkdSeq
LEFT JOIN BarCodes ON bkdBCDId=bcdId
LEFT JOIN PriceLookups ON bcdPLURecNo=pluRecNo
WHERE DATEDIFF(MINUTE,itaDateStamp,itapaidDate) > 60 AND itaDateStamp > DATEADD(YEAR,-1,GETDATE())
 ORDER BY itaDateStamp DESC

text: This was used on ticket 70735 for Exeter Cathedral on 13th March 2025. Members Expiry To Be Updated This will show all the Friends Card members who will expire within one year and are active members as of 13th March 2025, who will have their expiry updated to end on 31st December 2025. SELECT cusForeNames +' '+ cusSurname [Name], cusCardNum [Member Card No.], prvDateRenewed [Membership Renewed Date], prvDateExpires [Membership Expiry Date] FROM Account LEFT JOIN Customer ON AccRecNo=CusAccRecNo LEFT JOIN AccPrivilege ON accRecNo=prvAccRecNo AND cusSeq=prvCusSeq WHERE accBranch=1 AND prvCode='FRCARD' AND prvDateExpires = '13 MAR 2025' ORDER BY prvDateExpires ASC Friend Card Members Won't Be Updated This will show all the Friends Card members who will expire beyond one year and are active members as of 13th March 2025, who will not have their expiry updated to end on 31st December 2025. SELECT cusForeNames +' '+ cusSurname [Name], cusCardNum [Member Card No.], prvDateRenewed [Membership Renewed Date], prvDateExpires [Membership Expiry Date] FROM Account LEFT JOIN Customer ON AccRecNo=CusAccRecNo LEFT JOIN AccPrivilege ON accRecNo=prvAccRecNo AND cusSeq=prvCusSeq WHERE accBranch=1 AND prvCode='FRCARD' AND prvDateExpires > DATEADD(YEAR, 1, '13 MAR 2025') AND prvDateExpires >= '13 MAR 2025' ORDER BY prvDateExpires ASC
title: Members Expiry To Be Updated And Not To Be Updated
description:
This was used on ticket 70735 for Exeter Cathedral on 13th March 2025.


Members Expiry To Be Updated


This will show all the Friends Card members who will expire within one year and are active members as of 13th March 2025, who will have their expiry updated to end on 31st December 2025.


SELECT cusForeNames +' '+ cusSurname [Name], cusCardNum [Member Card No.], prvDateRenewed [Membership Renewed Date], prvDateExpires [Membership Expiry Date] FROM Account 
  LEFT JOIN Customer ON AccRecNo=CusAccRecNo 
  LEFT JOIN AccPrivilege ON accRecNo=prvAccRecNo AND cusSeq=prvCusSeq 
WHERE accBranch=1 
  AND prvCode='FRCARD'
  AND prvDateExpires < DATEADD(YEAR, 1, '13 MAR 2025')
  AND prvDateExpires >= '13 MAR 2025'
ORDER BY prvDateExpires ASC




Friend Card Members Won't Be Updated

 

This will show all the Friends Card members who will expire beyond one year and are active members as of 13th March 2025, who will not have their expiry updated to end on 31st December 2025.


SELECT cusForeNames +' '+ cusSurname [Name], cusCardNum [Member Card No.], prvDateRenewed [Membership Renewed Date], prvDateExpires [Membership Expiry Date] FROM Account 
  LEFT JOIN Customer ON AccRecNo=CusAccRecNo 
  LEFT JOIN AccPrivilege ON accRecNo=prvAccRecNo AND cusSeq=prvCusSeq 
WHERE accBranch=1 
  AND prvCode='FRCARD'
  AND prvDateExpires > DATEADD(YEAR, 1, '13 MAR 2025')
  AND prvDateExpires >= '13 MAR 2025'
ORDER BY prvDateExpires ASC

text: This will show all DD accounts where the customer account has been deleted. Therefore, when looking in DD Submissions, the DD account will be referenced, but not shown within the batch.
title: Customer Account Deleted For DD's
description: This will show all DD accounts where the customer account has been deleted. Therefore, when looking in DD Submissions, the DD account will be referenced, but not shown within the batch.

text: If a customer wants to see Internet bookings where payments are received over 15 minutes from booking created date. You can give them this data extract. SELECT itaDateStamp [Booking Created Date], itaPaidDate [Payment Success Received Date], itaBkhref [Booking Ref.], cusForeNames+' '+cusSurname [Customer Name], CASE WHEN bkhStatus = 'B' THEN 'Booked' WHEN bkhStatus = 'C' THEN 'Completed' WHEN bkhStatus = 'Z' THEN 'Unpaid Reservation' WHEN bkhStatus = 'X' THEN 'Cancelled' ELSE bkhStatus END [Current Booking Status] FROM InternetTransactionAudit JOIN Customer ON itaAccRecNo=cusAccRecNo AND itaCusSeq=cusSeq JOIN BKGHeader ON itaBkhref=bkhRef WHERE DATEDIFF(MINUTE, itaDateStamp,itaPaidDate) > 15 ORDER BY itaDateStamp DESC
title: Data Extract To See Internet Bookings Where Payments Are Received Over 15 Minutes From Booking Created Date
description:
If a customer wants to see Internet bookings where payments are received over 15 minutes from booking created date. You can give them this data extract.



SELECT itaDateStamp [Booking Created Date], itaPaidDate [Payment Success Received Date], itaBkhref [Booking Ref.], cusForeNames+' '+cusSurname [Customer Name],
  CASE
    WHEN bkhStatus = 'B' THEN 'Booked'
    WHEN bkhStatus = 'C' THEN 'Completed'
    WHEN bkhStatus = 'Z' THEN 'Unpaid Reservation'
    WHEN bkhStatus = 'X' THEN 'Cancelled'
    ELSE bkhStatus 
  END [Current Booking Status]
FROM InternetTransactionAudit 
  JOIN Customer ON itaAccRecNo=cusAccRecNo AND itaCusSeq=cusSeq
  JOIN BKGHeader ON itaBkhref=bkhRef
WHERE DATEDIFF(MINUTE, itaDateStamp,itaPaidDate) > 15
ORDER BY itaDateStamp DESC

text: This data extract will show Internet bookings where the price customer would have paid online differs to when the booking is completed at a till or via the auto-complete process. This is likely due to bookings where PLU Group Items and Advance Pricing has been used in conjunction, which will cause discrepancies. SELECT bkhRef [Booking Ref.], bkhBookedOn [Booked On Date], bkdBookingFrom [Booking For Date], bkhCompletedDate [Booking Completed Date], txnShortDesc [Item Description], txnLineSellValue [Internet Line Sell Price], LineValue [Booking Redemption Value] FROM BKGHeader JOIN BKGDetail ON bkhRef=bkdRef JOIN (SELECT * FROM TXNDetail WHERE txnTillNo=99) IntTXNDetail ON IntTXNDetail.txnOrderNo = bkdRef AND IntTXNDetail.txnOrderSeq = bkdSeq JOIN (SELECT txnOrderNo, txnOrderSeq, SUM(txnLineSellValue) [LineValue] FROM TXNDetail WHERE txnTillNo<>99 AND txnBCDId IN (SELECT pmlLinkBCDID FROM PLUMasterLink) GROUP BY txnorderno, txnOrderSeq) TillTXNDetail ON TillTXNDetail.txnOrderNo = bkdRef AND TillTXNDetail.txnOrderSeq = bkdSeq WHERE IntTXNDetail.txnLineSellValue <> TillTXNDetail.LineValue AND bkhBookedOn > '1 JAN 2024' ORDER BY bkhBookedOn DESC, IntTXNDetail.txnSeq ASC
title: PLU Group Bookings Price Discrepancies Data Extract
description:
This data extract will show Internet bookings where the price customer would have paid online differs to when the booking is completed at a till or via the auto-complete process.


This is likely due to bookings where PLU Group Items and Advance Pricing has been used in conjunction, which will cause discrepancies.


SELECT bkhRef [Booking Ref.], bkhBookedOn [Booked On Date], bkdBookingFrom [Booking For Date], bkhCompletedDate [Booking Completed Date], txnShortDesc [Item Description], txnLineSellValue [Internet Line Sell Price], LineValue [Booking Redemption Value]  FROM BKGHeader 
JOIN BKGDetail ON bkhRef=bkdRef 
JOIN (SELECT * FROM TXNDetail
      WHERE txnTillNo=99) IntTXNDetail ON IntTXNDetail.txnOrderNo = bkdRef 
    AND IntTXNDetail.txnOrderSeq = bkdSeq
JOIN (SELECT txnOrderNo, txnOrderSeq, SUM(txnLineSellValue) [LineValue] FROM TXNDetail
    WHERE txnTillNo<>99 
    AND txnBCDId IN (SELECT pmlLinkBCDID FROM PLUMasterLink)
    GROUP BY txnorderno, txnOrderSeq) TillTXNDetail ON TillTXNDetail.txnOrderNo = bkdRef AND TillTXNDetail.txnOrderSeq = bkdSeq
WHERE IntTXNDetail.txnLineSellValue <> TillTXNDetail.LineValue
  AND bkhBookedOn > '1 JAN 2024'
ORDER BY bkhBookedOn DESC, IntTXNDetail.txnSeq ASC

text: This data extract will show session seats where the seating block/carriage has since been removed for the seating plan linked to the session, which orphans all affected seats. SELECT shdDescription [Session Description], shdDateTime [Session Date & Time], shdRecNo [Session ID], spkDescr [Seating Block ID], spsSeatName [Seat Name], sstSesBkhRef [Booking Ref.], CASE WHEN sstUnAvailable = 1 THEN 'Yes' ELSE 'No' END [Seat Blocked?], sstReservedDateTime [Seat Reserved Time] FROM SessionSeats JOIN SessionHdr ON sstSHDRecNo=shdRecNo LEFT JOIN SeatingPlanLayout ON shdSeatingPlan=splSPHPlanId AND sstSPKBlockId=splSPKBlockId LEFT JOIN SeatingPlanBlocks ON sstSPKBlockId=spkBlockId LEFT JOIN SeatingPlanSeats ON spsSPKBlockId=spkBlockId AND sstSeatID=spsSeatID WHERE splSPHPlanId IS NULL AND sstReservedDateTime > '1 JAN 2025' ORDER BY sstReservedDateTime DESC
title: Orphaned Session Seats
description:
This data extract will show session seats where the seating block/carriage has since been removed for the seating plan linked to the session, which orphans all affected seats.


SELECT shdDescription [Session Description], shdDateTime [Session Date & Time], shdRecNo [Session ID], spkDescr [Seating Block ID], spsSeatName [Seat Name], sstSesBkhRef [Booking Ref.],
    CASE WHEN sstUnAvailable = 1 THEN 'Yes' ELSE 'No' END 
    [Seat Blocked?], sstReservedDateTime [Seat Reserved Time] FROM SessionSeats
  JOIN SessionHdr ON sstSHDRecNo=shdRecNo
  LEFT JOIN SeatingPlanLayout ON shdSeatingPlan=splSPHPlanId AND sstSPKBlockId=splSPKBlockId
  LEFT JOIN SeatingPlanBlocks ON sstSPKBlockId=spkBlockId
  LEFT JOIN SeatingPlanSeats ON spsSPKBlockId=spkBlockId AND sstSeatID=spsSeatID
WHERE splSPHPlanId IS NULL AND sstReservedDateTime > '1 JAN 2025'
ORDER BY sstReservedDateTime DESC

text: A collaborator is a type of Freshdesk Agent which has restricted permissions and does not use up a Freshdesk licence. They will normally be a K3 employee, or perhaps a partner. Detailed information on what they can and can't do is in What are the different Collaborator roles and privileges? : Freshdesk , but essentially, a Collaborator can use the agent portal to view Solution/KnowledgeBase articles, Collaborate with Ticket Notes and Conversation Threads view some reports, and view customers and contacts as well as some dashboards. Collaborating on a ticket rather than separate emails or Teams messages etc is an efficient way of capturing information required to resolve a ticket. Note: if a collaborator wants to raise a ticket, they will need to use the customer portal which can be done by clicking on your initial/icon top right, then click "Go to customer portal"
title: What is a Freshdesk Collaborator?
folder: Collaborating with agents and non-Support teams
description:
A collaborator is a type of Freshdesk Agent which has restricted permissions and does not use up a Freshdesk licence. They will normally be a K3 employee, or perhaps a partner.


Detailed information on what they can and can't do is in What are the different Collaborator roles and privileges? : Freshdesk , but essentially, a Collaborator can use the agent portal to view Solution/KnowledgeBase articles, Collaborate with Ticket Notes and Conversation Threads view some reports, and view customers and contacts as well as some dashboards.


Collaborating on a ticket rather than separate emails or Teams messages etc is an efficient way of capturing information required to resolve a ticket.


Note: if a collaborator wants to raise a ticket, they will need to use the customer portal which can be done by clicking on your initial/icon top right, then click "Go to customer portal"

text: As explained in this article, you can engage other people in Support, or anyone in K3 who has been set up as a Collaborator (e.g. Customer Success Managers) by: Adding a Private Note and @ mentioning them (they will get an email and a Freshdesk bell icon notification) Use Discussion Threads which are useful for having Teams-like chats with people, but without clogging up the ticket with lots of Notes. Threads can be at the Ticket or Note level - see more info at Collaborate within Freshdesk ticket using Discussion Threads : Freshdesk and Collaboration using Forward Threads in Freshdesk : Freshdesk For each individual thread on a ticket, you can click the expand button which will put the Thread into a full window DO NOT reply to an email from support if you want the reply to be internal only. If you reply and remove the customer from copy, thinking it will be only seen by Support, it will be posted as a PUBLIC note on the ticket (which the customer will see if they look on the portal). Why Not Use Teams Messages to Collaborate? We can collaborate on tickets using Teams, and occasionally that’s suitable, but in the main, this is to be avoided so that other team members can see what’s going on with a ticket. Keeping a track of all communications about a ticket in the one place (the ticket!) is best for all teams to understand the ticket, and communicate effectivley to the customer. If Teams is used to collaborate on a ticket (as an exception), a screenshot of the messages should be added as a Private Note to the ticket.
title: Collaborate with Ticket Notes and Conversation Threads
folder: Collaborating with agents and non-Support teams
description:
As explained in this article, you can engage other people in Support, or anyone in K3 who has been set up as a Collaborator (e.g. Customer Success Managers) by: 


  • Adding a Private Note and @ mentioning them (they will get an email and a Freshdesk bell icon notification)
  • Use Discussion Threads which are useful for having Teams-like chats with people, but without clogging up the ticket with lots of Notes. Threads can be at the Ticket or Note level - see more info at Collaborate within Freshdesk ticket using Discussion Threads : Freshdesk  and Collaboration using Forward Threads in Freshdesk : Freshdesk 


For each individual thread on a ticket, you can click the expand button which will put the Thread into a full window




DO NOT reply to an email from support if you want the reply to be internal only.

If you reply and remove the customer from copy, thinking it will be only seen by Support, it will be posted as a PUBLIC note on the ticket (which the customer will see if they look on the portal).



Why Not Use Teams Messages to Collaborate?

We can collaborate on tickets using Teams, and occasionally that’s suitable, but in the main, this is to be avoided so that other team members can see what’s going on with a ticket. Keeping a track of all communications about a ticket in the one place (the ticket!) is best for all teams to understand the ticket, and communicate effectivley to the customer.


If Teams is used to collaborate on a ticket (as an exception), a screenshot of the messages should be added as a Private Note to the ticket.

text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Getting Started Customer Information Useful Reports Support Upsells Tickets How to Find a Ticket and What do the Statuses Mean/Do? View List of Tickets for a Customer Exporting a Support Overview and List of Tickets Getting updates on Tickets with Notes and Threads (discussions) Opportunities/Orders from Support How to Escalate a Ticket Notifications to Customers and CSMs General FAQs Introduction There is a general overview of Support on the Hub here. This article is mostly about how CSMs can get what they need from Freshdesk, but also provides links to other useful information like what extra support services can be sold to customers. Getting Started In FreshDesk, CSMs are set up as collaborators which means you can view tickets and post private comments which the customer can't see (see What is a Freshdesk Collaborator? for more info). First step is to read the following articles from the internal Freshdesk Guide / Getting Started folder (you don't need to read them all because you do not have a full Support agent licence. Customer Information You can see all of the companies and contacts from this menu on the left: You can then filter by clicking the filter button on the top left and select a pre-built filter from the list, or type to search for pre-built filters such as "DdD". VIP Customers VIP customers are identified by the CSM Director and Managing Director, and have the "VIP Customer" dropdown set to Yes in Freshdesk Companies - see list here. Every time a new ticket is logged for a Company who is a VIP, the ticket gets a "VIP Customer" tag. You can see all open tickets for VIP customers in the 9f. Global All Open for VIP Companies ticket view, or search for a region's open VIP tickets by searching the ticket views for "VIP": Useful Reports The following may be useful before meeting a customer, or if a customer raises any issues Selected Customer Tickets Overview - gives a useful overview of the type of tickets, how many tickets. SLA adherence etc for a selectable customer and period. If you would like to download a copy of this, you will need to ask a full licence holder (see more info in Exporting a List of Tickets ) Selected Customer CSAT - summarises all customer satisfaction feedback on tickets for a selectable customer and period Tickets currently waiting for a CSM, sorted in nearest SLA due date Open, Passed to CSM Customer MStore Version Numbers Support Upsells By default, all new customers have standard working hours only support, and the standard SLA. Note that customers from before mid-2022 had extended support hours included by default which means that we can't attribute a value to it as it is not itemised (but we can reverse-engineer what it should/would have been which is done on the INTERNAL K3 Retail Solutions Support Options Pricing Model.xlsx Upsells for customers from Support are: Extended Hours. Support hours are described in What days and times is Support available? Premium SLA K3 MStore Database Optimisation and Maintenance Plan Tasks which customers want Support to perform, but are not included in their support agreement (see Opportunities/Orders from Support below) Brochures, PowerPoint, and pricing are contained on SharePoint in Retail Solutions Customer Support - SLA . Tickets How to Find a Ticket and What do the Statuses Mean/Do? You can find a ticket by simply typing in the number in the search box top right. You can see an explanation of what the ticket statues mean, how the SLA is activated/paused by them in Ticket Statuses Explained and How To Use Them View List of Tickets for a Customer If you want to see all tickets for a customer, you have three options: Go to the All Companies view, search for your customer, then click on the Tickets tab You can use the Selected Customer Tickets Overview report. By default the Royal Horticultural Society is selected, but click on the filter drop-down and search for the name of the customer you want to see tickets for. Note the timeframe and other filters are also available. Go to the Global All Tickets Ever Opened view, then filter on the right panel to the company you want to see (and add any other filters such as Created date, or only unresolved (open) tickets in the Status filter Exporting a Support Overview and List of Tickets Only a full licence holder can export a list of tickets. Usually at least one CSM team member has a full licence to do this for other CSMs. There are two ways of exporting a ticket list, but the first method also allows you to export a PDF of an entire report which includes a summary as well as ticket details. 1. The easiest method is by using the Selected Customer Tickets Overview report. Edit the report Clear the filter/previously saved companies by hovering over the company dropdown and clicking the Clear Filter button Change the customer to the one(s) you want , then Save the report You can then export the whole report, or just a ticket lists as described in 1a and 1b below 1a. Export a PDF of the entire report - Click the Export button and choose Email Now (which will email you a a PDF) or Download - Click Select all 1b. Export just the list of tickets Hover over the data in the report, a popup menu will appear. "CSV of tabula data" will download a file to your machine which can be opened in Excel (not that once opening, you'll want to save to an Excel file format instead of CSV if you want to add any Excel features such as conditional formatting) 2. The customisable (you can choose specific fields and other filter criteria which are not available on the Selected Customer Report), but more complicated method is to export from a Ticket View such as Global All Tickets Ever Opened Last 6mths which has been filtered. Using a ticket view, full licence holders can export the ticket list to a spreadsheet, but do encourage customers (and yourselves) to use the portal ticket list wherever possible. Collaborators (including CSMs) don't have permission to export which can't be changed, but you can copy/paste the URL of a search result to a full licence holder who can export and send to you (it will include a lot of fields you won't want, so you will need to format it). Suggested format is below. Note that time period as outlined below (defaults to last 7 days!) NOTE that customers need to request if they want to see all tickets for their company as explained on What can you see on the portal? ) Getting updates on Tickets with Notes and Threads (discussions) Please do not go to Support or Development staff direct for updates. You should always review the ticket first to see what updates are there (internal and to the customer). If you do not find what you need on the ticket already, you can add a Note to ask for an update IF: A ticket justifies being escalated, in which case, follow How to Escalate a Ticket and Manage the Escalation. The customer is asking you for an update, and the CSM has checked that they've not found what they need on the ticket, and the customer has asked for an update on the ticket and not had a timely reply You could ask them to request an update direct to Support via the ticket (or escalate to Support management if the Next Response Due has passed). If you post a Note asking for an update, the Support agent owning the ticket should provide a Public update so that you and the customer can see it. A Support Agent may want to consult a CSM on a ticket in which case they may add a Note or Thread and @mention you which will trigger an email to you with a link to reply in Freshdesk. For a brief overview of Notes and Threads, see Collaborate with Ticket Notes and Conversation Threads Opportunities/Orders from Support There is a ticket status of Passed to Customer Success Manager as explained in Passed to Customer Success Manager . This may happen if an Order is required in which case the CSM should ideally enter the order in CRM and add a note to the Freshdesk ticket so that if a customer enquires in future, the Support team can tie it back to an Order if they need to (similar advantage if the CRM order has the Freshdesk ticket number in it). See General Guide to Identifying & Booking Chargeable Work involving Support for guidance on how to make sure that everything from Support tickets is managed How to Escalate a Ticket See How to Escalate a Ticket and Manage the Escalation which includes instructions for CSMs and the support team. Notifications to Customers and CSMs Please see What email notifications are sent to customers? If a Priority 1 ticket is raised, the CSM assigned in CRM (which is imported into Freshdesk) will be sent a notification along with all support managers. Note that the import from CRM is only done every few weeks, so any change in CSM might take a while to be reflected in Freshdesk. General FAQs What if a customer needs help using the Support portal? There are instructions on How to use this portal and what to expect from Support , but if the customer has read them and still needs help, please let the Support Managers know so more instructions can be added What If a Customer Raises a Support Request to a CSM? Ask the customer to raise it directly with Support so that our system recognises the ticket as coming from them (i.e. do not forward an email like this to Support because it will just get raised under your name) If it's not possible or appropriate to ask the customer to raise the request direct to Support (particularly if it's a change you've agreed with them, not an issue), you can email Support yourself and copy the customer. You will get the new ticket notification, but the customer will not. Support will need to change the contact and send a notification to the customer as per How to change the contact on an open ticket
title: Guide to Support and Freshdesk for Customer Success Managers (CSMs)
folder: Collaborating with agents and non-Support teams
description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • Getting Started
  • Customer Information
  • Useful Reports
  • Support Upsells
  • Tickets
    • How to Find a Ticket and What do the Statuses Mean/Do?
    • View List of Tickets for a Customer
    • Exporting a Support Overview and List of Tickets
    • Getting updates on Tickets with Notes and Threads (discussions)
    • Opportunities/Orders from Support
    • How to Escalate a Ticket
  • Notifications to Customers and CSMs
  • General FAQs


Introduction

There is a general overview of Support on the Hub here. This article is mostly about how CSMs can get what they need from Freshdesk, but also provides links to other useful information like what extra support services can be sold to customers.


Getting Started

In FreshDesk, CSMs are set up as collaborators which means you can view tickets and post private comments which the customer can't see (see What is a Freshdesk Collaborator? for more info).


First step is to read the following articles from the internal Freshdesk Guide / Getting Started folder (you don't need to read them all because you do not have a full Support agent licence.


Customer Information

You can see all of the companies and contacts from this menu on the left:



You can then filter by clicking the filter button on the top left and select a pre-built filter from the list, or type to search for pre-built filters such as "DdD".



VIP Customers

VIP customers are identified by the CSM Director and Managing Director, and have the "VIP Customer" dropdown set to Yes in Freshdesk Companies - see list here.


Every time a new ticket is logged for a Company who is a VIP, the ticket gets a "VIP Customer" tag. You can see all open tickets for VIP customers in the 9f. Global All Open for VIP Companies ticket view, or search for a region's open VIP tickets by searching the ticket views for "VIP":


Useful Reports

The following may be useful before meeting a customer, or if a customer raises any issues

  • Selected Customer Tickets Overview - gives a useful overview of the type of tickets, how many tickets. SLA adherence etc for a selectable customer and period. If you would like to download a copy of this, you will need to ask a full licence holder (see more info in Exporting a List of Tickets )
  • Selected Customer CSAT - summarises all customer satisfaction feedback on tickets for a selectable customer and period
  • Tickets currently waiting for a CSM, sorted in nearest SLA due date Open, Passed to CSM 
  • Customer MStore Version Numbers


Support Upsells

By default, all new customers have standard working hours only support, and the standard SLA. Note that customers from before mid-2022 had extended support hours included by default which means that we can't attribute a value to it as it is not itemised (but we can reverse-engineer what it should/would have been which is done on the INTERNAL K3 Retail Solutions Support Options Pricing Model.xlsx 


Upsells for customers from Support are:

  1. Extended Hours. Support hours are described in What days and times is Support available? 
  2. Premium SLA
  3. K3 MStore Database Optimisation and Maintenance Plan 
  4. Tasks which customers want Support to perform, but are not included in their support agreement (see Opportunities/Orders from Support below)


Brochures, PowerPoint, and pricing are contained on SharePoint in Retail Solutions Customer Support - SLA .


Tickets

How to Find a Ticket and What do the Statuses Mean/Do?

You can find a ticket by simply typing in the number in the search box top right.


You can see an explanation of what the ticket statues mean, how the SLA is activated/paused by them in Ticket Statuses Explained and How To Use Them


View List of Tickets for a Customer

If you want to see all tickets for a customer, you have three options:

  1. Go to the All Companies view, search for your customer, then click on the Tickets tab


  2. You can use the Selected Customer Tickets Overview report. By default the Royal Horticultural Society is selected, but click on the filter drop-down and search for the name of the customer you want to see tickets for. Note the timeframe and other filters are also available.


  3. Go to the Global All Tickets Ever Opened view, then filter on the right panel to the company you want to see (and add any other filters such as Created date, or only unresolved (open) tickets in the Status filter

Exporting a Support Overview and List of Tickets

Only a full licence holder can export a list of tickets. Usually at least one CSM team member has a full licence to do this for other CSMs.


There are two ways of exporting a ticket list, but the first method also allows you to export a PDF of an entire report which includes a summary as well as ticket details.


1. The easiest method is by using the Selected Customer Tickets Overview report.

  • Edit the report
  • Clear the filter/previously saved companies by hovering over the company dropdown and clicking the Clear Filter button
  • Change the customer to the one(s) you want , then Save the report


You can then export the whole report, or just a ticket lists as described in 1a and 1b below


1a. Export a PDF of the entire report

- Click the Export button and choose Email Now (which will email you a a PDF) or Download


- Click Select all


1b. Export just the list of tickets

  • Hover over the data in the report, a popup menu will appear.
  • "CSV of tabula data" will download a file to your machine which can be opened in Excel (not that once opening, you'll want to save to an Excel file format instead of CSV if you want to add any Excel features such as conditional formatting)


2. The customisable (you can choose specific fields and other filter criteria which are not available on the Selected Customer Report), but more complicated method is to export from a Ticket View such as  Global All Tickets Ever Opened Last 6mths which has been filtered.


  • Using a ticket view, full licence holders can export the ticket list to a spreadsheet, but do encourage customers (and yourselves) to use the portal ticket list wherever possible.
    • Collaborators (including CSMs) don't have permission to export which can't be changed, but you can copy/paste the URL of a search result to a full licence holder who can export and send to you (it will include a lot of fields you won't want, so you will need to format it). Suggested format is below.
    • Note that time period as outlined below (defaults to last 7 days!)
    • NOTE that customers need to request if they want to see all tickets for their company as explained on What can you see on the portal? )


Getting updates on Tickets with Notes and Threads (discussions)

Please do not go to Support or Development staff direct for updates.

You should always review the ticket first to see what updates are there (internal and to the customer). 


If you do not find what you need on the ticket already, you can add a Note to ask for an update IF:

  • A ticket justifies being escalated, in which case, follow  How to Escalate a Ticket and Manage the Escalation.
  • The customer is asking you for an update, and the CSM has checked that they've not found what they need on the ticket, and the customer has asked for an update on the ticket and not had a timely reply
    • You could ask them to request an update direct to Support via the ticket (or escalate to Support management if the Next Response Due has passed).
    • If you post a Note asking for an update, the Support agent owning the ticket should provide a Public update so that you and the customer can see it.


A Support Agent may want to consult a CSM on a ticket in which case they may add a Note or Thread and @mention you which will trigger an email to you with a link to reply in Freshdesk.


For a brief overview of Notes and Threads, see Collaborate with Ticket Notes and Conversation Threads 


Opportunities/Orders from Support

There is a ticket status of Passed to Customer Success Manager as explained in Passed to Customer Success Manager . This may happen if an Order is required in which case the CSM should ideally enter the order in CRM and add a note to the Freshdesk ticket so that if a customer enquires in future, the Support team can tie it back to an Order if they need to (similar advantage if the CRM order has the Freshdesk ticket number in it).


See General Guide to Identifying & Booking Chargeable Work involving Support for guidance on how to make sure that everything from Support tickets is managed


How to Escalate a Ticket

See How to Escalate a Ticket and Manage the Escalation which includes instructions for CSMs and the support team.



Notifications to Customers and CSMs

Please see What email notifications are sent to customers? 


If a Priority 1 ticket is raised, the CSM assigned in CRM (which is imported into Freshdesk) will be sent a notification along with all support managers. Note that the import from CRM is only done every few weeks, so any change in CSM might take a while to be reflected in Freshdesk.


General FAQs

  • What if a customer needs help using the Support portal?
    • There are instructions on How to use this portal and what to expect from Support , but if the customer has read them and still needs help, please let the Support Managers know so more instructions can be added
  • What If a Customer Raises a Support Request to a CSM?
    • Ask the customer to raise it directly with Support so that our system recognises the ticket as coming from them (i.e. do not forward an email like this to Support because it will just get raised under your name)
If it's not possible or appropriate to ask the customer to raise the request direct to Support (particularly if it's a change you've agreed with them, not an issue), you can email Support yourself and copy the customer.

You will get the new ticket notification, but the customer will not.

Support will need to change the contact and send a notification to the customer as per How to change the contact on an open ticket

text: TABLE OF CONTENTS What is an Escalation? CSMs Support Agents Support Management What is an Escalation? A customer escalation is a case that a customer has contacted us about because they believe it's not being dealt with quickly enough. A valid escalation is where we agree it needs management attention because one or more of the following apply: The Service Level Agreement is breached (or near to being breached) It's a critical customer The issue can have serious commercial consequences If an escalation request doesn't meet this criteria, it is not valid. This includes escalation requests from internal people which have not been initiated by a customer directly. Note that this process is not the same as the Critical / Major Incident handling process An escalation could be received via a CSM, or by a customer requesting it in a ticket. CSMs If you receive a request for an escalation from a customer, please follow these steps: Look up the ticket and see if it's within the Resolution SLA, review the priority and activity on the ticket. Decide if you think the ticket should be escalated, or if you need to tell the customer that the ticket is in hand and within Resolution SLA and so an escalation is not reasonable/justified. This might prompt a discussion on if the correct Ticket Priority has been assigned - perhaps the Urgency has increased since the ticket was raised If they are not sure about the Urgency, Impact, and calculated Ticket Priority, please check if they are signed up to the Support Portal and encourage them to sign up if not You might even want to point them to the How quickly can I expect my ticket to be dealt with? which also links to the full Service Level Agreement (SLA) If you think the customer is justified in escalating the ticket, add a Note to the ticket (which will be private i.e. customers won't see what you write) @mention the Support managers in the Note so they are alerted to the escalation request Include in the note the reason for the escalation (summary of phone call or copy of email text is fine) Useful tip: Next to the Add note button, there is also a favourite icon which means if you click it, you will be added as a ticket watcher and will get notified of all updates to the ticket. You can also see a list of all tickets you're watching by selecting the Tickets I'm watching ticket view. The assigned Support manager will carry out the review, update the ticket and update you via a Discussion Thread. This Thread should be where you respond to anything the Support Manager asks/tells you about the escalation (do not add more Notes about the escalation to keep the ticket clear of clutter, and keep all messages about the escalation in one place). Support Agents If you see an update on a ticket asking for it to be escalated, follow steps 1-2 in the CSM section above. If you believe the escalation is valid, update the Escalated dropdown and complete the (mandatory) Escalation Reason box Teams message your line manager, but if they're not available, then message the Duty Manager Note: When dealing with an escalation, the most important thing is ownership and being informative. Escalations is a good example of where there's no such thing as too much information. Always assume that there is someone waiting to get an update. Be proactive with updates rather than making the stakeholders ask for them. Always get help from Head of if you are stuck. Follow standard process for ticket handling, but always ensure it is prioritised. Don't treat it as higher than P2 (unless it's a P1 in which case it shouldn't have needed to be escalated because these are top priority) It is OK to keep chasing people when dealing with these cases, if you don't get a reply, ask again. Support Management Review the escalation request and it it's valid, and update the Escalated dropdown to "Yes" (if not already set by a Support agent), or to "Rejected" If it's not valid, set the indicator to Rejected and explain why to the CSM or Support agent who can communicate back to the customer If the escalation request was raised by a CSM adding a Note to the ticket, add a Thread to that note and @mention the CSM with an update. If the Support team initiated the escalation then you will need to add a brief Note to be a container for the escalation discussion thread. Adding a thread to the Note will keep all further discussion about the escalation in one place and clear of the main ticket feed. If the SLA is breached/critical customer/serious financial consequences, then this ticket is a valid escalation. Immediate actions are: Escalation Manager and ticket owner revaluates the priority. Support agent confirms to customer that the ticket has been escalated. The Escalation Manager will assist to get appropriate resources involved where needed, and help push to get the ticket correctly prioritised (even if it's with another team like Software Development) Note: the Escalation Manager will not contact the customer direct (this will continue to be done by the assigned support agent). This is to avoid the Support Manager becoming the regular contact point. A ticket can be directly assigned to 2nd line to ensure swift resolution.
title: How to Escalate a Ticket and Manage the Escalation
folder: Collaborating with agents and non-Support teams
description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • What is an Escalation?
  • CSMs
  • Support Agents
  • Support Management

What is an Escalation?

A customer escalation is a case that a customer has contacted us about because they believe it's not being dealt with quickly enough.
A valid escalation is where we agree it needs management attention because one or more of the following apply:

  • The Service Level Agreement is breached (or near to being breached)
  • It's a critical customer
  • The issue can have serious commercial consequences

If an escalation request doesn't meet this criteria, it is not valid. This includes escalation requests from internal people which have not been initiated by a customer directly.

Note that this process is not the same as the Critical / Major Incident handling process

 

An escalation could be received via a CSM, or by a customer requesting it in a ticket.


CSMs

If you receive a request for an escalation from a customer, please follow these steps:

  1. Look up the ticket and see if it's within the Resolution SLA, review the priority and activity on the ticket.
  2. Decide if you think the ticket should be escalated, or if you need to tell the customer that the ticket is in hand and within Resolution SLA and so an escalation is not reasonable/justified.
    1. This might prompt a discussion on if the correct Ticket Priority has been assigned - perhaps the Urgency has increased since the ticket was raised
    2. If they are not sure about the Urgency, Impact, and calculated Ticket Priority, please check if they are signed up to the Support Portal and encourage them to sign up if not
    3. You might even want to point them to the How quickly can I expect my ticket to be dealt with? which also links to the full Service Level Agreement (SLA)
  3. If you think the customer is justified in escalating the ticket, add a Note to the ticket (which will be private i.e. customers won't see what you write)
    1. @mention the Support managers in the Note so they are alerted to the escalation request
    2. Include in the note the reason for the escalation (summary of phone call or copy of email text is fine) 

      Useful tip:
      Next to the Add note button, there is also a favourite icon which means if you click it, you will be added as a ticket watcher and will get notified of all updates to the ticket. You can also see a list of all tickets you're watching by selecting the Tickets I'm watching ticket view.
  4. The assigned Support manager will carry out the review, update the ticket and update you via a Discussion Thread. This Thread should be where you respond to anything the Support Manager asks/tells you about the escalation (do not add more Notes about the escalation to keep the ticket clear of clutter, and keep all messages about the escalation in one place).


Support Agents

  1. If you see an update on a ticket asking for it to be escalated, follow steps 1-2 in the CSM section above.
  2. If you believe the escalation is valid, update the Escalated dropdown and complete the (mandatory) Escalation Reason box
  3. Teams message your line manager, but if they're not available, then message the Duty Manager


Note:

When dealing with an escalation, the most important thing is ownership and being informative.

Escalations is a good example of where there's no such thing as too much information.

 

  • Always assume that there is someone waiting to get an update.
  • Be proactive with updates rather than making the stakeholders ask for them.
  • Always get help from Head of if you are stuck.

 

Follow standard process for ticket handling, but always ensure it is prioritised. Don't treat it as higher than P2 (unless it's a P1 in which case it shouldn't have needed to be escalated because these are top priority)

 

It is OK to keep chasing people when dealing with these cases, if you don't get a reply, ask again.


Support Management

  1. Review the escalation request and it it's valid, and update the Escalated dropdown to "Yes" (if not already set by a Support agent), or to "Rejected" 
    1. If it's not valid, set the indicator to Rejected and explain why to the CSM or Support agent who can communicate back to the customer
  2. If the escalation request was raised by a CSM adding a Note to the ticket, add a Thread to that note and @mention the CSM with an update. If the Support team initiated the escalation then you will need to add a brief Note to be a container for the escalation discussion thread.
    1. Adding a thread to the Note will keep all further discussion about the escalation in one place and clear of the main ticket feed.
  3. If the SLA is breached/critical customer/serious financial consequences, then this ticket is a valid escalation. Immediate actions are:
    1. Escalation Manager and ticket owner revaluates the priority.
    2. Support agent confirms to customer that the ticket has been escalated.
    3. The Escalation Manager will assist to get appropriate resources involved where needed, and help push to get the ticket correctly prioritised (even if it's with another team like Software Development)


Note:

  • the Escalation Manager will not contact the customer direct (this will continue to be done by the assigned support agent). This is to avoid the Support Manager becoming the regular contact point.
  • A ticket can be directly assigned to 2nd line to ensure swift resolution.
