What If a Developer Needs More Info from Support/Customer? If a note is put in Jira requesting more information, the Support Agent should see the Note added in the FD ticket and then change the Status to Open (if Support need to get more info) or to Waiting For Customer along with sending the request to the customer. Note that any tickets set to Waiting for Customer which have not had a response after 14 days will be closed (customers receive a reminder after 7 days). What To Do When Closing a Jira There is no automatic notification to Freshdesk if a linked Jira is closed. Therefore, before closing a Jira which has a linked Freshdesk ticket, please post a note in the Jira to say that it's being closed, and why. This note will then appear on the Freshdesk ticket and trigger Support to take action. Dev Teams NOT using Jira Development teams not using Jira can use Freshdesk, but only as Collaborators. This means they cannot be assigned tickets, or change statuses etc, but they can add Notes and Threads (see Collaborate with Ticket Notes and Conversation Threads ) Process for Support to Pass to Development Support will change the Status to "Waiting for Development" (see Ticket Statuses Explained and How To Use Them if you want to understand more about the different ticket statuses), Support will then Forward the ticket to the developer(s) - the Forward action in Threads in Freshdesk will just send them an email with a link to the ticket). Process for Development to Update Support, and Support to Assign Ticket You can see all open tickets for Walton (for example) which are Waiting for Development in this view You can also find the view or see all other views by clicking Tickets, then the Filter button start typing to search, or scroll down the list of views. Make sure you are using Table View of tickets and have configured the columns as explained/recommended in Configure fields for the ticket Table View Because Development are not full licence holders, you cannot have the ticket assigned to you, but you can add a Note or Thread to @mention the Support Agent telling them who will be working on the ticket. Support can them assign a ticket to them by using Internal Groups - select the relevant Internal Group, then the Internal Agent if you know who it will be assigned to in the Dev team Process for Development to Pass Back to Support Simply add a Note or add to a Thread a request for the ticket to be passed back to Support with an update as to why e.g. a fix has been delivered, or more information is needed from the customer. Change the Jira to "Support Review" status (Support will then change the Freshdesk ticket status). @mentioning the Support agent in the Note/Thread will help them notice the update Imagine Product Documentation Documentation for these products can be found in this Freshdesk Knowledgebase (also known as Solutions) by clicking on the Solutions menu on the left vertical menu bar. The Development teams maintain the product documentation Only contacts logged into https://support.k3btg.com can see articles, and they can only see articles for products which their Company has purchased (i.e. If you have a full Freshdesk licence and are therefore permitted to create/edit articles, there is a whole section on how to use the KB at Guidance on Solutions / Knowledge Base.
title: Freshdesk Guide for Development Teams
folder: Collaborating with agents and non-Support teams
description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • Getting Started
  • Dev Teams using Jira
    • Why Access Freshdesk?
    • How are Jiras Created and What's Synchronised?
    • What If a Developer Needs More Info from Support/Customer?
    • What To Do When Closing a Jira
  • Dev Teams NOT using Jira
    • Process for Support to Pass to Development
    • Process for Development to Update Support, and Support to Assign Ticket
    • Process for Development to Pass Back to Support
  • Imagine Product Documentation


Getting Started

If this is your first time here, you might want to follow the Getting Started section in Freshdesk Guide for Customer Success Managers (CSMs). They will be making more use of looking at company and ticket information than Development need to, but at least the Getting Started should be useful to you.


Development team members don't have to look in Freshdesk, but it might be useful...


Dev Teams using Jira

Why Access Freshdesk?

If your development team uses Jira, you don't really need to use Freshdesk, but you do need to understand how/why Jiras are created from Freshdesk, what happens afterwards, and by having a Collaborator licence for Freshdesk, you can click on the Freshdesk support ticket link in Jira if you want to see more details on the Support ticket.



Some things you can see on a Support Ticket which you won't see in Jira include if the ticket is for a VIP customer



How are Jiras Created and What's Synchronised?

If you want to see the process which the Support team goes through to create a Jira, please see Guide for Support to create Jiras for Development from Freshdesk and how Support and Dev can collaborate on them . Note that it's also possible for Support Team members to link a Freshdesk ticket to one or more Jiras (and for one of the Jiras to be selected as the primary one on the FD ticket). - see Updating tickets with an Existing Jira 


In summary, once a Jira is created from a Freshdesk ticket (Bug or Story depending on if the Freshdesk ticket is an Incident or Change Request), all Jira comments will be synced to Freshdesk, and all Private Notes (i.e. ones which customers can't see) will be sent to the Jira ticket including attachments.


What If a Developer Needs More Info from Support/Customer?

If a note is put in Jira requesting more information, the Support Agent should see the Note added in the FD ticket and then change the Status to Open (if Support need to get more info) or to Waiting For Customer along with sending the request to the customer.


Note that any tickets set to Waiting for Customer which have not had a response after 14 days will be closed (customers receive a reminder after 7 days).


What To Do When Closing a Jira

There is no automatic notification to Freshdesk if a linked Jira is closed. Therefore, before closing a Jira which has a linked Freshdesk ticket, please post a note in the Jira to say that it's being closed, and why. This note will then appear on the Freshdesk ticket and trigger Support to take action.



Dev Teams NOT using Jira

Development teams not using Jira can use Freshdesk, but only as Collaborators. This means they cannot be assigned tickets, or change statuses etc, but they can add Notes and Threads (see Collaborate with Ticket Notes and Conversation Threads )


Process for Support to Pass to Development

  1. Support will change the Status to "Waiting for Development" (see Ticket Statuses Explained and How To Use Them if you want to understand more about the different ticket statuses),
  2. Support will then Forward the ticket to the developer(s) - the Forward action in Threads in Freshdesk will just send them an email with a link to the ticket).


Process for Development to Update Support, and Support to Assign Ticket

You can see all open tickets for Walton (for example) which are Waiting for Development in this view

You can also find the view or see all other views by clicking Tickets, then the Filter button start typing to search, or scroll down the list of views.




Make sure you are using Table View of tickets and have configured the columns as explained/recommended in Configure fields for the ticket Table View


  • Because Development are not full licence holders, you cannot have the ticket assigned to you, but you can add a Note or Thread to @mention the Support Agent telling them who will be working on the ticket.
  • Support can them assign a ticket to them by using Internal Groups - select the relevant Internal Group, then the Internal Agent if you know who it will be assigned to in the Dev team




Process for Development to Pass Back to Support

Simply add a Note or add to a Thread a request for the ticket to be passed back to Support with an update as to why e.g. a fix has been delivered, or more information is needed from the customer. Change the Jira to "Support Review" status (Support will then change the Freshdesk ticket status).


@mentioning the Support agent in the Note/Thread will help them notice the update



Imagine Product Documentation

Documentation for these products can be found in this Freshdesk Knowledgebase (also known as Solutions) by clicking on the Solutions menu on the left vertical menu bar. The Development teams maintain the product documentation


Only contacts logged into https://support.k3btg.com can see articles, and they can only see articles for products which their Company has purchased (i.e. 


If you have a full Freshdesk licence and are therefore permitted to create/edit articles, there is a whole section on how to use the KB at Guidance on Solutions / Knowledge Base.

text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Getting Started Process for Support to Pass to Solutions Delivery Process for Solutions Delivery to Update Support Note!! Getting Started If this is your first time here, you might want to follow the Getting Started section in Freshdesk Guide for Customer Success Managers (CSMs). They will be making more use of looking at company and ticket information than Solutions Delivery need to, but at least the Getting Started should be useful to you. The Solutions Delivery team use Freshdesk as Collaborators (free licences). This means they cannot be assigned tickets, or change statuses etc, but they can add Notes and Threads (see Collaborate with Ticket Notes and Conversation Threads ) Process for Support to Pass to Solutions Delivery Support will change the Status to "Waiting for Solutions Delivery" (see Ticket Statuses Explained and How To Use Them if you want to understand more about the different ticket statuses), The "Waiting for Solutions Delivery" status will then enable the Internal Group dropdown on the ticket, from where they will select "Solutions Delivery" If the Internal agent is known/agreed, then they can be selected from the dropdown and Support will Forward the ticket to the internal agent (the Forward action in Freshdesk will just send an email with a link to the ticket) Process for Solutions Delivery to Update Support You can see all open tickets for Solutions Delivery in this view You can also find the view or see all other views by clicking Tickets, then the Filter button start typing to search, or scroll down the list of views) Make sure you are using Table View of tickets and have configured the columns as explained/recommended in Configure fields for the ticket Table View To update the ticket, simply add a Private Note (free licences cannot add public notes anyway). If you want to converse with a support agent or anyone else with a full or free licence, just @mention them in the private note, or use a Thread if it's a discussion which you don't want to fill up the ticket with notes (see Collaborate with Ticket Notes and Conversation Threads ). If you need to send a message to a customer, you will need to add this as a Private Note and @mention the support agent to then send it to the customer If you want to pass a ticket back to Support, then please also add a note and @mention the support agent so they can change the ticket status Note!! If a ticket status is changed to Waiting for Customer (by a support agent), then the customer responds, the ticket is put back into Open status which means that because it's no longer in Waiting on Solution Delivery, the Internal Group and Internal Agent values are reset to nothing
title: Freshdesk Guide for Solutions Delivery
folder: Collaborating with agents and non-Support teams
description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • Getting Started
  • Process for Support to Pass to Solutions Delivery
  • Process for Solutions Delivery to Update Support
  • Note!!


Getting Started

If this is your first time here, you might want to follow the Getting Started section in Freshdesk Guide for Customer Success Managers (CSMs). They will be making more use of looking at company and ticket information than Solutions Delivery need to, but at least the Getting Started should be useful to you.


The Solutions Delivery team use Freshdesk as Collaborators (free licences). This means they cannot be assigned tickets, or change statuses etc, but they can add Notes and Threads (see Collaborate with Ticket Notes and Conversation Threads )


Process for Support to Pass to Solutions Delivery

  1. Support will change the Status to "Waiting for Solutions Delivery" (see Ticket Statuses Explained and How To Use Them if you want to understand more about the different ticket statuses),
  2. The "Waiting for Solutions Delivery" status will then enable the Internal Group dropdown on the ticket, from where they will select "Solutions Delivery"
  3. If the Internal agent is known/agreed, then they can be selected from the dropdown and Support will Forward the ticket to the internal agent (the Forward action in Freshdesk will just send an email with a link to the ticket)


Process for Solutions Delivery to Update Support

You can see all open tickets for Solutions Delivery in this view

You can also find the view or see all other views by clicking Tickets, then the Filter button start typing to search, or scroll down the list of views)


Make sure you are using Table View of tickets and have configured the columns as explained/recommended in Configure fields for the ticket Table View


To update the ticket, simply add a Private Note (free licences cannot add public notes anyway). 

If you want to converse with a support agent or anyone else with a full or free licence, just @mention them in the private note, or use a Thread if it's a discussion which you don't want to fill up the ticket with notes (see Collaborate with Ticket Notes and Conversation Threads ).


  • If you need to send a message to a customer, you will need to add this as a Private Note and @mention the support agent to then send it to the customer
  • If you want to pass a ticket back to Support, then please also add a note and @mention the support agent so they can change the ticket status


Note!!


If a ticket status is changed to Waiting for Customer (by a support agent), then the customer responds, the ticket is put back into Open status which means that because it's no longer in Waiting on Solution Delivery, the Internal Group and Internal Agent values are reset to nothing

text: Normally a customer creates the items he wants to sell in his store manually in the inventory management, so he has to put in a lot of effort. Nowadays, many suppliers already label their goods with EAN, prices and other information (see image of a S'Oliver label). In principle, an award from the dealer is no longer necessary in such a case. In principle, with the basic delivery of Cowis.Net Backoffice, the retailer (customer) already has the opportunity to maintain the EAN for his created items and could save himself the trouble of printing out labels. But that would mean the retailer would still have to create the items in the Cowis.Net back office and then add the EAN for each color/size. This works, but it is time-consuming. What benefit does it bring to the customer? - He no longer has to create his articles himself - He no longer has to enter orders from the ordering season - He does not have to record goods receipt manually - he no longer has to worry about restocking goods (some things are possible or must) Of course, EDI also has a downside: - the dealer gives up his independence in the production of the item, so he can no longer say that the item is called "Bluse Marion" but has to adopt the name of the supplier. - Most suppliers want to receive the retailer's sales data in return That's why the industry came up with EDI a long time ago. EDI = Electronic Data Interchange = Electronic data exchange
title: What is EDI and what does it bring to the customer?
description:
Normally a customer creates the items he wants to sell in his store manually in the inventory management, so he has to put in a lot of effort.


Nowadays, many suppliers already label their goods with EAN, prices and other information (see image of a S'Oliver label). In principle, an award from the dealer is no longer necessary in such a case.




In principle, with the basic delivery of Cowis.Net Backoffice, the retailer (customer) already has the opportunity to maintain the EAN for his created items and could save himself the trouble of printing out labels. But that would mean the retailer would still have to create the items in the Cowis.Net back office and then add the EAN for each color/size.

This works, but it is time-consuming.


What benefit does it bring to the customer?

- He no longer has to create his articles himself

- He no longer has to enter orders from the ordering season

- He does not have to record goods receipt manually

- he no longer has to worry about restocking goods

(some things are possible or must)


Of course, EDI also has a downside:

- the dealer gives up his independence in the production of the item, so he can no longer say that the item is called "Bluse Marion" but has to adopt the name of the supplier.

- Most suppliers want to receive the retailer's sales data in return


That's why the industry came up with EDI a long time ago.

EDI = Electronic Data Interchange = Electronic data exchange

text: EDI = Electronic Data Interchange GLN / ILN = Global Location Number or International Location Number (both terms are in common use Clearing center = central point that collects data in different formats from suppliers, processes it and distributes it to customers The supplier sends these messages to the retailer PRICAT = Price Catalog (master data) ORDRSP = Order Response (order confirmation) INVOIC = Invoice not used in Cowis.Net DESADV = Despatch Advice (delivery notes) The retailer can send these messages to the supplier SLSRPT = Sales Report INVRPT = Inventory Report ORDERS = Order Not all types of messages always have to be exchanged; it can also happen that the supplier only knows PRICAT and DESADV or the dealer does not want to send SLSRPT.
title: Definitions of terms
description:
EDI = Electronic Data Interchange

GLN / ILN = Global Location Number or International Location Number (both terms are in common use

Clearing center = central point that collects data in different formats from suppliers, processes it and distributes it to customers


The supplier sends these messages to the retailer

PRICAT = Price Catalog (master data)

ORDRSP = Order Response (order confirmation)

INVOIC = Invoice not used in Cowis.Net

DESADV = Despatch Advice (delivery notes)


The retailer can send these messages to the supplier

SLSRPT = Sales Report

INVRPT = Inventory Report

ORDERS = Order

Not all types of messages always have to be exchanged; it can also happen that the supplier only knows PRICAT and DESADV or the dealer does not want to send SLSRPT.

text: Go to the address of the relevant supplier using Change Go to Edit on the contact page In the window that opens, go to New Enter a description and the GLN Now incoming EDI messages with different GLNs are assigned to a supplier
title: How can you use multiple GLNs with one supplier?
description:
Go to the address of the relevant supplier using Change


Go to Edit on the contact page



In the window that opens, go to New



Enter a description and the GLN



Now incoming EDI messages with different GLNs are assigned to a supplier

title: Article master data - PRICAT
description:
The transmission of the article base takes place either accompanying to the order (“accompanying 

PRICAT”) which is sent by the supplier to the retailer, or independently for certain assortments (“assortment PRICAT”).

The accompanying PRICAT is a single transaction. Later modifications at the supplier are not relevant. Therefore, no change or replacement indication is needed here.

The assortment PRICAT informs the retailer about the current master data status at the supplier. Therefore, additions, deletions or changes are transmitted. In exceptional cases a complete replacement of the assortment will also be transmitted. For pure changes in price the PRICAT is used in the version price-list (see Chapter II, Part 2).

1.    Content of the message

1.1. Message header

With the accompanying PRICAT and the first transmission of an assortment PRICAT the document function is always 9 for original. In this case the fields „ reference PRICAT “, „ date valid from “ and „ date valid to “ are not used.

 

Format

1.2. Message group

The fields “group code” and “group name” can be used in the assortment PRICAT to identify the specific assortment. Besides, the coded form must be unique. The name is only used for better understanding. In the accompanying PRICAT these fields are not used.

1.3. Message position

Up to priority 3 the contents should be supplied. For a transition period these values are still optional. This is for easier adaptation. However, this limits the usability strongly.

title: What does the different DDDadmin settings do ?

text: If a customer would like to have all future Internet bookings inherit the booking type that is set on its respective booking template, rather than the booking type set to Internet, then you will need to run the below SQL: BEGIN TRANSACTION UPDATE Options SET optValue=1 WHERE optCode='BKGTYPTMPL' AND optBranch=1 --COMMIT If the customer would also like us to retrospectively change previous Internet bookings booking type to what is currently set for the booking templates they were booked from, then you can run the below SQL, specifying the booking template(s) they want to be changed on the rare occasion they would like this. SELECT * INTO BAKBKGHeader29MAR23 FROM BKGHeader BEGIN TRANSACTION UPDATE a SET a.bkhType=b.bthBookingType FROM BKGHeader a JOIN BKGTemplateHdr b ON a.bkhTemplateID=b.bthTemplateId WHERE bkhIsInternet=1 --AND bkhTemplateID IN ('') --COMMIT
title: Inherit Booking Type From Booking Template For Internet Bookings
description:
If a customer would like to have all future Internet bookings inherit the booking type that is set on its respective booking template, rather than the booking type set to Internet, then you will need to run the below SQL: 

  

BEGIN TRANSACTION  

UPDATE Options 

SET optValue=1 

WHERE optCode='BKGTYPTMPL' AND optBranch=1 

--COMMIT  

  

If the customer would also like us to retrospectively change previous Internet bookings booking type to what is currently set for the booking templates they were booked from, then you can run the below SQL, specifying the booking template(s) they want to be changed on the rare occasion they would like this. 

  

SELECT * INTO BAKBKGHeader29MAR23 FROM BKGHeader 

  

BEGIN TRANSACTION  

UPDATE a 

SET a.bkhType=b.bthBookingType 

FROM BKGHeader a 

JOIN BKGTemplateHdr b ON a.bkhTemplateID=b.bthTemplateId 

WHERE bkhIsInternet=1 --AND bkhTemplateID IN ('') 

--COMMIT

text: To add or update reports within Mstore: Open Reports Browse to the report group you want to add the new report to: Import: Select the report file you require (Reports are stored on Server2012 if you require any report files) Click Open. Add. If the report already exists you will get a duplicate key error. Will need to delete the report first before you can re-add it. Ensure you also add the updated stored procedure otherwise you will get error.

text: For the pseudo till setup part as normal they just go into the Tills Configuration screen add a new till with a unique ID that has not been used previously and name it as required. The main difference is they then pick the type of ‘Other’ where shown (you will see this greys out the peripherals options as it is not a physical till). They then pick the Department and Stock Location for this till as usual and (if applicable) and opening float amount. The only difference is they need to select something called the ‘Default PLU’ that sales (recorded via the a back office process called a Post Adjustment) will be recorded against by default. But they do not have to records sales against the default PLU as when making a Post Adjustment they can pick the PLU(s) to record the sales against as required. The default PLU is just a PLU they set up with the required code, description, analysis code and VAT rate and is typically set to £0 price, the key thing is the ‘Override Price is set to ‘Allow Price Override’
title: Pseudo Till Setup
description:
For the pseudo till setup part as normal they just go into the Tills Configuration screen add a new till with a unique ID that has not been used previously and name it as required. The main difference is they then pick the type of ‘Other’ where shown (you will see this greys out the peripherals options as it is not a physical till). They then pick the Department and Stock Location for this till as usual and (if applicable) and opening float amount. The only difference is they need to select something called the ‘Default PLU’ that sales (recorded via the a back office process called a Post Adjustment) will be recorded against by default. But they do not have to records sales against the default PLU as when making a Post Adjustment they can pick the PLU(s) to record the sales against as required.

 

 

The default PLU is just a PLU they set up with the required code, description, analysis code and VAT rate and is typically set to £0 price, the key thing is the ‘Override Price is set to ‘Allow Price Override’

text: To see how fragmented a database is, you can run the below SQL: select name, avg_fragmentation_in_percent from sys.dm_db_index_physical_stats (DB_ID('AdventureWorks2012'), object_id('Sales.SalesOrderDetail'), NULL, NULL, NULL) as a join sys.indexes as b on a.object_id = b.object_id and a.index_id = b.index_id ORDER BY avg_fragmentation_in_percent DESC To then re-index the database, you need to run the below. Once complete, you can run the first SQL statement to see how much/what has changed. USE [MStore] DECLARE @TableName varchar(255) DECLARE TableCursor CURSOR FOR SELECT table_name FROM information_schema.tables WHERE table_type = 'base table' OPEN TableCursor FETCH NEXT FROM TableCursor INTO @TableName WHILE @@FETCH_STATUS = 0 BEGIN DBCC DBREINDEX(@TableName,' ',90) FETCH NEXT FROM TableCursor INTO @TableName END CLOSE TableCursor DEALLOCATE TableCursor
title: Re-Index MStore Databases
description:
To see how fragmented a database is, you can run the below SQL:

 

select name, avg_fragmentation_in_percent

 

from sys.dm_db_index_physical_stats (DB_ID('AdventureWorks2012'), object_id('Sales.SalesOrderDetail'), NULL, NULL, NULL) as a

join sys.indexes as b on a.object_id = b.object_id and a.index_id = b.index_id

 

ORDER BY avg_fragmentation_in_percent DESC

 

To then re-index the database, you need to run the below. Once complete, you can run the first SQL statement to see how much/what has changed.

 

USE [MStore]

 

DECLARE @TableName varchar(255)

DECLARE TableCursor CURSOR FOR

SELECT table_name FROM information_schema.tables

 

WHERE table_type = 'base table'

OPEN TableCursor

FETCH NEXT FROM TableCursor INTO @TableName

WHILE @@FETCH_STATUS = 0

BEGIN

DBCC DBREINDEX(@TableName,' ',90)

FETCH NEXT FROM TableCursor INTO @TableName

END

CLOSE TableCursor

DEALLOCATE TableCursor

text: Replacing New TXNs and Updated TXNs: If the till has blanked out the NEW and UPD files, you can re-build the files to restore the cash draw to the till. STOP MERAC UPDATER SERVICE Find the last transaction number from the TXN file, enter this in LastTXN= ;Merac Ltd New Transactions Created ;Do Not Delete or modify this file LastTXN=171608 Drawer=002|1 ;end OR ;Merac Ltd New Transactions Created ;Do Not Delete or modify this file LastTXN=1002 ;end ;Merac Ltd New Transactions Created ;Do Not Delete or modify this file LastTXN=171608 Drawer(Closed)=002 ;end Set the LastTxnUpdated to be the last transaction in the database: ;Merac Ltd Transactions Updated ;Do not delete or modify this file LastTXNUpdated=171608 ;end Restart the MeracUpdater service
title: Restoring Till Cash Draw
description:
Replacing New TXNs and Updated TXNs:

 

If the till has blanked out the NEW and UPD files, you can re-build the files to restore the cash draw to the till.

STOP MERAC UPDATER SERVICE

Find the last transaction number from the TXN file, enter this in LastTXN=

 

 

;Merac Ltd New Transactions Created

;Do Not Delete or modify this file

LastTXN=171608

Drawer=002|1

;end

 

OR

 

;Merac Ltd New Transactions Created

;Do Not Delete or modify this file

LastTXN=1002

;end

 

 

;Merac Ltd New Transactions Created

;Do Not Delete or modify this file

LastTXN=171608

Drawer(Closed)=002

;end

 

Set the LastTxnUpdated to be the last transaction in the database:

 

 

;Merac Ltd Transactions Updated

;Do not delete or modify this file

LastTXNUpdated=171608

;end   

 

Restart the MeracUpdater service

text: Also see: Stuck Cash Drawer Replacing NEW or UPD TXN Files Here are instructions for the bare minimum that needs to be done when dealing with cash drawers stuck open. Always request access to the till in question for the full amount of time when performing these instructions. Sometimes best when the till has stopped trading. Whatever you do in the Back Office, you need to make sure matches on the till. E.g. Closing the cash drawer in the Back Office, will also need the corresponding cash drawer file to be archived on the till. Otherwise,the till will say the cash drawer is already open when the till operator goes to open the same cash drawer number. Check in till program that there are no cash drawer’s currently showing open. Look in C:\ProgramData\Merac\TillTXNs, which will consist of a History folder, NEWTXNS.xxx, UPDTXNS.xxx & TXNxxx.yyy files, where x is referring to till number and y is referring to cash drawer number. Till’s can have multiple of these files if the till number has traded on these different till numbers overtime, including the training till 999). NEWTXNS.xxx, UPDTXNS.xxx files older than a month can be archived to the History folder. TXNxxx.yyy older than a month, compare with cash drawers for the till in question showing open in Tills in the Back Office with today’s date selected. The till number can be derived in the Back Office by clicking Edit, Edit Config from certain screen ONLY, like Home or Setup. Till name can be cross-referenced by this number in Setup->Till Configuration. Any TXNxxx.yyy in the TillTXNs folder older than a month and not in Tills in the Back Office can be archived to the History folder. If Windows prompt about overwriting any TXNxxx.yyy, cancel and append the modified date on the end of the file name (TXN-18OCT20xxx.yyy). This tidies up the folder to allow easier to work with. Any left over TXNxxx.yyy files, open the file, take note of the time & date in the first, OPN line (opening record) and then find the last PAY line (to avoid picking up voided transactions), which looks like so; PAY,[Branch No.],[Till No.], [Cash Drawer No.], [Transaction No.],…… E.g. PAY,1,1,999,1325876,1,52,0,,,,,,,0,0,0,False,,,,,,,,0,0,GBP,52,1. Take note of the transaction No. and find the cash drawer corresponding to the till & cash drawer No.’s and opening time & date in Tills. Double-click on this cash drawer, then File (top left), View Transactions. Keep clicking Next to make sure the Till TXN No. from the last PAY line is in the database. If it is, close the transaction window and then press [F2]. Then Yes and OK on the following prompts to close the cash drawer in the Back Office. Archive the corresponding TXNxxx.yyy file to the History folder, then double-check the LastTXN number in NEWTXNS.xxx is reasonably high number (1000+), to make sure this has not receded back to 1 at some point (normally due to power cuts). Also make sure there are no lines showing Drawer=yyy|1, where the till thinks there should be a cash drawer open. If you feel the transaction number has receded or a cash drawer line is showing, archive both files to History and open the till program where the below prompt will appear. Click Ok for the till will query the database to get the latest transaction number and rebuild these files.
title: Stuck Open Cash Drawer Issue
description:
Also see:

Stuck Cash Drawer

Replacing NEW or UPD TXN Files


Here are instructions for the bare minimum that needs to be done when dealing with cash drawers stuck open. 

 

    1. Always request access to the till in question for the full amount of time when performing these instructions. Sometimes best when the till has stopped trading. Whatever you do in the Back Office, you need to make sure matches on the till. E.g. Closing the cash drawer in the Back Office, will also need the corresponding cash drawer file to be archived on the till. Otherwise,the till will say the cash drawer is already open when the till operator goes to open the same cash drawer number.
    2. Check in till program that there are no cash drawer’s currently showing open.

 

 

 

    1. Look in C:\ProgramData\Merac\TillTXNs, which will consist of a History folder, NEWTXNS.xxx, UPDTXNS.xxx & TXNxxx.yyy files, where x is referring to till number and y is referring to cash drawer number. Till’s can have multiple of these files if the till number has traded on these different till numbers overtime, including the training till 999). NEWTXNS.xxx, UPDTXNS.xxx files older than a month can be archived to the History folder. TXNxxx.yyy older than a month, compare with cash drawers for the till in question showing open in Tills in the Back Office with today’s date selected. The till number can be derived in the Back Office by clicking Edit, Edit Config from certain screen ONLY, like Home or Setup. Till name can be cross-referenced by this number in Setup->Till Configuration.

 

   

 

    1. Any TXNxxx.yyy in the TillTXNs folder older than a month and not in Tills in the Back Office can be archived to the History folder. If Windows prompt about overwriting any TXNxxx.yyy, cancel and append the modified date on the end of the file name (TXN-18OCT20xxx.yyy). This tidies up the folder to allow easier to work with.

 

   

 

    1. Any left over TXNxxx.yyy files, open the file, take note of the time & date in the first, OPN line (opening record) and then find the last PAY line (to avoid picking up voided transactions), which looks like so; PAY,[Branch No.],[Till No.], [Cash Drawer No.], [Transaction No.],…… E.g. PAY,1,1,999,1325876,1,52,0,,,,,,,0,0,0,False,,,,,,,,0,0,GBP,52,1.

 

 

    1. Take note of the transaction No. and find the cash drawer corresponding to the till & cash drawer No.’s and opening time & date in Tills.

 

 

    1. Double-click on this cash drawer, then File (top left), View Transactions. Keep clicking Next to make sure the Till TXN No. from the last PAY line is in the database.

 

 

    1. If it is, close the transaction window and then press [F2]. Then Yes and OK on the following prompts to close the cash drawer in the Back Office.

 

   

 

    1. Archive the corresponding TXNxxx.yyy file to the History folder, then double-check the LastTXN number in NEWTXNS.xxx is reasonably high number (1000+), to make sure this has not receded back to 1 at some point (normally due to power cuts). Also make sure there are no lines showing Drawer=yyy|1, where the till thinks there should be a cash drawer open.

 

 

    1. If you feel the transaction number has receded or a cash drawer line is showing, archive both files to History and open the till program where the below prompt will appear. Click Ok for the till will query the database to get the latest transaction number and rebuild these files.

text: When unable to force close the cash draw via back office because it's been disabled (To prevent customers from force closing the cash draw in back office) Double click on the cash draw you want to force close: Click on File and select 'View Transactions' Get the Opening record transaction number: Insert the transaction number below: Select * from CashDraw Where csdOpenTXNNo = 1489521 Once confirmed this is the correct opening record. Use the below SQL to force close the cash draw: begin transaction Update CashDraw Set csdClosedAt = GETDATE(), csdClosedBy = 100, csdStatus = 'C' Where csdOpenTXNNo = 1489521 --commit --rollback Change GETDATE() to the date required if you don't want the current date
title: SQL – Force Close Cash Draw
description:
When unable to force close the cash draw via back office because it's been disabled (To prevent customers from force closing the cash draw in back office)

 

 

Double click on the cash draw you want to force close:

 

 

 

Click on File and select 'View Transactions'

 

 

Get the Opening record transaction number:

 

 

Insert the transaction number below:

 

Select * from CashDraw 

Where csdOpenTXNNo = 1489521

 

Once confirmed this is the correct opening record. Use the below SQL to force close the cash draw:

 

begin transaction

Update CashDraw 

Set csdClosedAt = GETDATE(), csdClosedBy = 100, csdStatus = 'C'

Where csdOpenTXNNo = 1489521

--commit

--rollback

 

Change GETDATE() to the date required if you don't want the current date

text: If you see transactions stuck in TillTXNs to be processed into the database, first check there isn't an error lower down in the TillTXNs table for that till number. Secondly, check MeracPDB is running. Thirdly, make sure there are no SQL transactions that have not been COMMITed or ROLLBACKed. Quickest way to do this is to restart the SQL service, which will revert any transactions back. Fourthly, check the DBUpdate.ini, which is generally located in C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac folder of where the MeracPDB service is installed, which is usually on the server. Within here, make sure all server lines are correctly linking to live databases. If one of the server lines do not, this can cause MeracPDB from processing transactions for all other databases. You can comment server lines out with ; at the beginning, and restart the MeracPDB service to see if this has resolved the issue.
title: Transactions Stuck In TillTXNs With No Error
description:
If you see transactions stuck in TillTXNs to be processed into the database, first check there isn't an error lower down in the TillTXNs table for that till number.

 

Secondly, check MeracPDB is running.

 

Thirdly, make sure there are no SQL transactions that have not been COMMITed or ROLLBACKed. Quickest way to do this is to restart the SQL service, which will revert any transactions back.

 

Fourthly, check the DBUpdate.ini, which is generally located in C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac folder of where the MeracPDB service is installed, which is usually on the server. Within here, make sure all server lines are correctly linking to live databases. If one of the server lines do not, this can cause MeracPDB from processing transactions for all other databases. You can comment server lines out with ; at the beginning, and restart the MeracPDB service to see if this has resolved the issue.

text: Follow the below SQL to backup the current table, and then set the price for mainland, Europe and rest of world, with the corresponding fields for each from weight you specify, which is in kg, to the nearest 0.01kg. Note: If you put the price as –1 for any of the fields, this won't show as available for this weight for the location online. There is also a web config that refers the weight specified below to the total cost of the basket, if the customer would prefer to calculate the price on the basket price: https://axk3btg.sharepoint.com/sites/SDSupport/_layouts/OneNote.aspx?id=%2Fsites%2FSDSupport%2FShared%20Documents%2FGeneral%2FKnowledge%20and%20Training%2FSupport%20Product%20Knowledge%20Base&wd=target%28MStore.one%7C0CED2557-2827-4C76-A491-95F9CD8189E7%2FConfig%20Files%7C407A7505-3A2F-496C-9A97-0A96E86147EF%2F%29 onenote:https://axk3btg.sharepoint.com/sites/SDSupport/Shared%20Documents/General/Knowledge%20and%20Training/Support%20Product%20Knowledge%20Base/MStore.one#Config%20Files&section-id={0CED2557-2827-4C76-A491-95F9CD8189E7}&page-id={407A7505-3A2F-496C-9A97-0A96E86147EF}&object-id={BB20AED6-32E2-4C19-81D7-2A3AEC921227}&76 SELECT * FROM OrderPostage SELECT * INTO BAKOrderPostage[Date] FROM OrderPostage BEGIN TRANSACTION UPDATE OrderPostage SET odpUkMainland='', odpEurope='', odpRestofWorld='' WHERE odpFromWeight='' --COMMIT BEGIN TRANSACTION UPDATE OrderPostage SET odpUkMainland='', odpEurope='', odpRestofWorld='' WHERE odpFromWeight='' --COMMIT BEGIN TRANSACTION UPDATE OrderPostage SET odpUkMainland='', odpEurope='', odpRestofWorld='' WHERE odpFromWeight='' --COMMIT BEGIN TRANSACTION UPDATE OrderPostage SET odpUkMainland='', odpEurope='', odpRestofWorld='' WHERE odpFromWeight='' --COMMIT

text: When you try to change the department a user / employee is assigned to, but the only option is the one they are currently assigned to. This is a bug in some versions. Fix by setting the EmpDeptNo to 0 (All Departments) e.g. SELECT * FROM Departments WHERE empUserName LIKE '%%' Begin Transaction update employee set empDptNo =0 where empUserName ='MJS' commit Once set to all departments the correct department can be selected and saved. Back up Employee table first as a precaution.
title: Unable to change a User's Department
description:
When you try to change the department a user / employee is assigned to, but the only option is the one they are currently assigned to.

This is a bug in some versions.

 

 

Fix by setting the EmpDeptNo to 0 (All Departments)

e.g.

SELECT * FROM Departments
WHERE empUserName LIKE '%%'

Begin Transaction
update employee
set empDptNo =0
where empUserName ='MJS'
commit

 

Once set to all departments the correct department can be selected and saved.

 

Back up Employee table first as a precaution.

text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Ticket Management Upgrade Process Post Upgrade Internal Updates Ticket Management Every Upgrade must have a ticket raised (so we can manage/plan who's doing it, when) The ticket should be a Service Request/Software Delivery Request if it's a functional upgrade, or an Incident if the upgrade is fixing a bug Make sure the ticket has one of the below tags before commencing the upgrade, just so that it's crystal clear what the reason for the upgrade is. If the tag is absent, ask the agent who last dealt with the ticket to add the correct tag Upgrade-Free Upgrade-BugFix When scheduling the upgrade, the effort for upgrades is free if it's in normal working hours (Mon-Fri 9-5:30 excl. Public Holidays), always chargeable if out of hours. The exception is if it's during normal hours, but more than one upgrade is done in any 12 month period for functional (not bug-fixing) reasons, then it's chargeable. When communicating with customers about an upgrade, you can refer them to MStore Core System Upgrade Process so they know what to expect. Upgrade Process Check and act on any stuck transactions on TillTXNs SQL table. Login to SQL Management studio and take a full back up the MStore database. Backup relevant stored procedures. Browse to the E:\ftproot\support\ver3.15.0\3.15.8.x folder and copy across to the site's server. Lookup the Meracdata location on the customers server. This can be found in the system options. (If you are copying via OneDrive, make sure you unblock the exe files). Browse to the “Updatenewver\Cache” folder within Meracdata. E.g. D:\MeracData\updatenewver\cache. Delete all 7.zip files. Copy and replace the newer upgrade files in to this location. Stop the MeracPDB & MeracProxyService Services within windows Services. If there is a newer version of PDBUpdater.exe, replace this in either C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac or C:\Program Files\Merac (whichever is present). Run the correct SQL Upgrade scripts in order until everything has run successfully. E.g. SQL_3500_MStore_Update.sql, then SQL_4000_MStore_Update.sql, then SQL_4500_MStore_Update.sql. If one script fails, run it a second, and sometimes a third time. To know what script to start with, check the script number from the back-office login screen (in brackets, next to the version). Run the script that is 500 or less in the batch number, to make sure no batches are missed off. Open the Back Office and then click Setup, MStore Updater. Click "Update Server Cache Files to Database" button. This process writes all the files saved to MeracData\updatenewver\cache to UpdateServerFiles table within SQL. Click "Authorize All Files to Copy From Now" button. Click "Authorize All Files to Copy and Install From Now" button. Click "Force Software Update for all Tills/Computers" button. Exit all MStore applications, restart MeracUpdater service and start MeracPDB service. Wait a few seconds and load the back office. It will now show up to date. Login in and Click "Recreate till Data" to force the MeracDat file update just in case the structure of the Dat file has changed as a result of the Merac Update. Remote onto a few tills till to verify that the update has worked. Click Update button and once the update is complete, then double-click an open, blue area in the top right-hand side of the button program to verify that the system has been updated successfully (i.e. version info will be displayed). Make sure that after the upgrade, you check that the basic back office, and till functions work as expected, then ask the customer to verify as well. MStore Server Update Procedure complete! Post Upgrade Internal Updates Every completed upgrade must have the following updated/checked: Update the Software Version Number on the Contract record for the company. If the upgrade was not done to fix a fault (i.e. it was a functional upgrade and the ticket has the tag Upgrade-Free), please add the date to MStore Last Free Functional Upgrade as shown below Check if the customer has the Upgrade Overdue checkbox ticked - see 1e. MStore Upgrade Overdue If they do, then please message on the UK Support chat that the customer is no longer on an out of date version, and @ tag Odd and Richard so that one of them removes the checkbox from the Company record
title: MStore Database Upgrade Process
description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • Ticket Management
  • Upgrade Process
  • Post Upgrade Internal Updates


Ticket Management

  • Every Upgrade must have a ticket raised (so we can manage/plan who's doing it, when)
    • The ticket should be a Service Request/Software Delivery Request if it's a functional upgrade, or an Incident if the upgrade is fixing a bug


Make sure the ticket has one of the below tags before commencing the upgrade, just so that it's crystal clear what the reason for the upgrade is. If the tag is absent, ask the agent who last dealt with the ticket to add the correct tag

Upgrade-Free
Upgrade-BugFix


  • When scheduling the upgrade, the effort for upgrades is free if it's in normal working hours (Mon-Fri 9-5:30 excl. Public Holidays), always chargeable if out of hours. The exception is if it's during normal hours, but more than one upgrade is done in any 12 month period for functional (not bug-fixing) reasons, then it's chargeable.
  • When communicating with customers about an upgrade, you can refer them to MStore Core System Upgrade Process so they know what to expect.

 

Upgrade Process

    1. Check and act on any stuck transactions on TillTXNs SQL table.
    2. Login to SQL Management studio and take a full back up the MStore database. Backup relevant stored procedures.
    3. Browse to the E:\ftproot\support\ver3.15.0\3.15.8.x folder and copy across to the site's server.
    4. Lookup the Meracdata location on the customers server. This can be found in the system options. (If you are copying via OneDrive, make sure you unblock the exe files).

    1. Browse to the “Updatenewver\Cache” folder within Meracdata. E.g. D:\MeracData\updatenewver\cache.
    2. Delete all 7.zip files.
    3. Copy and replace the newer upgrade files in to this location.
    4. Stop the MeracPDB & MeracProxyService Services within windows Services.
    5. If there is a newer version of PDBUpdater.exe, replace this in either C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac or C:\Program Files\Merac (whichever is present).
    6. Run the correct SQL Upgrade scripts in order until everything has run successfully. E.g. SQL_3500_MStore_Update.sql, then SQL_4000_MStore_Update.sql, then SQL_4500_MStore_Update.sql. If one script fails, run it a second, and sometimes a third time. To know what script to start with, check the script number from the back-office login screen (in brackets, next to the version). Run the script that is 500 or less in the batch number, to make sure no batches are missed off.
    7. Open the Back Office and then click Setup, MStore Updater. Click "Update Server Cache Files to Database" button. This process writes all the files saved to MeracData\updatenewver\cache to UpdateServerFiles table within SQL. 

Click "Authorize All Files to Copy From Now" button. 

Click "Authorize All Files to Copy and Install From Now" button.    

Click "Force Software Update for all Tills/Computers" button.

 

    1. Exit all MStore applications, restart MeracUpdater service and start MeracPDB service. Wait a few seconds and load the back office. It will now show up to date.
    2. Login in and Click "Recreate till Data" to force the MeracDat file update just in case the structure of the Dat file has changed as a result of the Merac Update.
    3. Remote onto a few tills till to verify that the update has worked. Click Update button and once the update is complete, then double-click an open, blue area in the top right-hand side of the button program to verify that the system has been updated successfully (i.e. version info will be displayed).

 



Make sure that after the upgrade, you check that the basic back office, and till functions work as expected, then ask the customer to verify as well.



MStore Server Update Procedure complete!



Post Upgrade Internal Updates

Every completed upgrade must have the following updated/checked: 

  • Update the Software Version Number on the Contract record for the company.
  • If the upgrade was not done to fix a fault (i.e. it was a functional upgrade and the ticket has the tag Upgrade-Free), please add the date to MStore Last Free Functional Upgrade as shown below

  • Check if the customer has the Upgrade Overdue checkbox ticked - see 1e. MStore Upgrade Overdue
    • If they do, then please message on the UK Support chat that the customer is no longer on an out of date version, and @ tag Odd and Richard so that one of them removes the checkbox from the Company record

text: This can be caused by changes made on a ticket design, may have accidentally made the width of a field into a negative width. This then does not show in the Receipt Designer, but can be seen in PrintLayoutLine SQL table. SQL Used for fix (for reference): SELECT * FROM PrintLayoutHeader WHERE plhDescription LIKE '%seat all%' select * from PrintLayoutLine where pllOPOSWidth < 0 SELECT * FROM PrintLayoutLine WHERE pllPLHID=1191 SELECT * INTO BAKPrintLayoutLine17FEB23 FROM PrintLayoutLine BEGIN TRANSACTION UPDATE PrintLayoutLine SET pllOPOSWidth=7, pllWidthmm=15 WHERE pllPLHID=1191 AND pllSection='B' AND pllSubSection=0 AND pllSeq=1 --COMMIT Once performed, don't forget to recreate till data and update tills affected.
title: "Invalid procedure call or argument" Error When Printing Tickets
description:
This can be caused by changes made on a ticket design, may have accidentally made the width of a field into a negative width. This then does not show in the Receipt Designer, but can be seen in PrintLayoutLine SQL table.

 

 

 

 

SQL Used for fix (for reference):

 

SELECT * FROM PrintLayoutHeader

WHERE plhDescription LIKE '%seat all%'

 

select * from PrintLayoutLine 

where pllOPOSWidth < 0

 

 

 

SELECT * FROM PrintLayoutLine

WHERE pllPLHID=1191

 

SELECT * INTO BAKPrintLayoutLine17FEB23 FROM PrintLayoutLine

 

BEGIN TRANSACTION 

UPDATE PrintLayoutLine

SET pllOPOSWidth=7, pllWidthmm=15

WHERE pllPLHID=1191 AND pllSection='B' AND pllSubSection=0 AND pllSeq=1

--COMMIT 

 

Once performed, don't forget to recreate till data and update tills affected.

text: A few sites use the functionality that means the users passwords expired after x number of days: This means occasionally when you log into a customer site with MJS you will get: Please DO NOT change the MJS account password or you will lock everyone else in support out Simply go into the database and run: Update Employee Set empPwdChanged = GETDATE() Where empNumber = 100 You will now be able to log in.
title: Unable to log into Mstore - Password Expired
description:
A few sites use the functionality that means the users passwords expired after x number of days:

 

 

 

This means occasionally when you log into a customer site with MJS you will get:

 

 

 

Please DO NOT change the MJS account password or you will lock everyone else in support out

 

Simply go into the database and run:

 

Update Employee 

Set empPwdChanged = GETDATE()

Where empNumber = 100

 

You will now be able to log in.

text: There is a function within the database to re-calculate gift aid if site had made a mistake and it needs to be re-calculated Under Stored Procedures: It may not exist, can be added by running the below SQL: USE [MStore] GO /****** Object: StoredProcedure [dbo].[UTIL_RecalculateGiftAidTable] Script Date: 12/05/2023 13:11:42 ******/ SET ANSI_NULLS ON GO SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON GO CREATE procedure [dbo].[UTIL_RecalculateGiftAidTable] @FromDateTime varchar(20), @ToDateTime varchar(20) as declare @FDT datetime declare @TDT datetime select @FDT=convert(datetime,@FromDateTime) select @TDT=convert(datetime,@ToDateTime) Update Giftaid set gftClaimAmount = (ISNULL((SELECT SUM(txnLineSellValue) FROM TXNDetail INNER JOIN BarCodes ON txnBCDId = bcdId INNER JOIN PriceLookups ON txnBranch = pluBranchNo AND bcdPLURecNo = pluRecNo WHERE gftBranch = txnBranch AND gftTxnNo = txnNo AND txnStatus <> 'V' AND pluGiftAid = 1), 0)) Where gfttxnno in (select txhno from txnheader where txhcompleted>=@FDT and txhcompleted<=@TDT) and gftDateClaimed is NUll GO Run between the dates required. Always back up the database before running.
title: Gift Aid - Not calculated correctly
description:
There is a function within the database to re-calculate gift aid if site had made a mistake and it needs to be re-calculated

 

Under Stored Procedures:

 

 

It may not exist, can be added by running the below SQL:

 

USE [MStore]

GO

 

/****** Object:   StoredProcedure [dbo].[UTIL_RecalculateGiftAidTable]    Script Date: 12/05/2023 13:11:42 ******/

SET ANSI_NULLS ON

GO

 

SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON

GO

 

CREATE procedure [dbo].[UTIL_RecalculateGiftAidTable]

 @FromDateTime varchar(20),

 @ToDateTime varchar(20)

 

as

 

declare @FDT datetime

declare @TDT datetime

select @FDT=convert(datetime,@FromDateTime)

select @TDT=convert(datetime,@ToDateTime)

Update Giftaid set gftClaimAmount = 

(ISNULL((SELECT SUM(txnLineSellValue) FROM TXNDetail 

                 INNER JOIN BarCodes ON txnBCDId = bcdId 

                 INNER JOIN PriceLookups ON txnBranch = pluBranchNo 

                AND bcdPLURecNo = pluRecNo 

                                WHERE gftBranch = txnBranch AND

                                                 gftTxnNo = txnNo AND txnStatus <> 'V' AND pluGiftAid = 1), 0))

  

 Where gfttxnno in (select txhno from txnheader where txhcompleted>=@FDT

                and txhcompleted<=@TDT) and gftDateClaimed is NUll

GO

 

 

 

Run between the dates required. Always back up the database before running.

text: Backing up a database: In object explorer, connect to the database instance required. Right click on the database you want to back up and select tasks, Back Up: Click Add: Specify a backup location and name the copy something sensible. Ensure you include.bak (In older versions it will save it as a file you won't be able to restore!) Click Ok, It will show the progress in the bottom left and will pop up with complete once done. Restoring a database: Right click on the databases tab, select 'Restore Database' Select Device, click on the three dots to select a file to restore Click 'Add' and select the database file you backed up Rename your database as required: (If you don't change the name it will try and overwrite the live Mstore database!) Click on the Files option, ensure the files have picked up the new name. Older versions it doesn't update. It will fail to create files if they are named the same. You also want to ensure you don't overwrite the live ones. Click OK. Your database should now be in the list: If you get any errors, it’s generally because of lack of space or you are trying to restore it with the same name as an existing database. Deleting a database: If you need to force close connections, select the bottom tick box. It will disconnect anyone connected. DO NOT USE THIS ON ANY LIVE DATABASES. ONLY BACKUPS.
title: Backing up / Restoring databases
description:
Backing up a database:

 

In object explorer, connect to the database instance required. 

 

Right click on the database you want to back up and select tasks, Back Up:

 

 

Click Add:

 

 

Specify a backup location and name the copy something sensible. Ensure you include.bak (In older versions it will save it as a file you won't be able to restore!)

 

 

Click Ok, It will show the progress in the bottom left and will pop up with complete once done.

 

Restoring a database:

 

Right click on the databases tab, select 'Restore Database'

 

 

Select Device, click on the three dots to select a file to restore

 

 

Click 'Add' and select the database file you backed up

 

 

Rename your database as required:

 

 

(If you don't change the name it will try and overwrite the live Mstore database!)

 

Click on the Files option, ensure the files have picked up the new name. Older versions it doesn't update. It will fail to create files if they are named the same. You also want to ensure you don't overwrite the live ones.

 

 

Click OK.

 

 

 

Your database should now be in the list:

 

 

If you get any errors, it’s generally because of lack of space or you are trying to restore it with the same name as an existing database.

 

Deleting a database:

 

 

 

If you need to force close connections, select the bottom tick box. It will disconnect anyone connected. 

 

DO NOT USE THIS ON ANY LIVE DATABASES. ONLY BACKUPS.

text: You can use SQL Server Profiler to track down which stored procedure is running when troubleshooting Opening profiler: You will need to connect profiler to the same database instance that you want to trace Profiler will open with the below screen: You can name your trace if required, only bother if you want to save it. Select Events Selection to allow us to filter out unnecessary processes. .NET logs very rapidly and is used by the online side. By default you will have: Generally you will not need Audit Login, Audit Logout, Existing Connection. Can be useful to leave BatchStarting and BatchCompleted so you can see how long a process takes To filter out .NET, select Column Filters: Add .NET% Click Run. The trace will now pick up what you are running in Mstore (Providing it's not within the program code) Things like reports can be run manually now in SSMS This will then show all the report info. Trace settings can be saved for future.
title: Using SQL Server Profiler
description:
You can use SQL Server Profiler to track down which stored procedure is running when troubleshooting

 

Opening profiler:

 

 

You will need to connect profiler to the same database instance that you want to trace

 

 

Profiler will open with the below screen:

 

You can name your trace if required, only bother if you want to save it.

 

 

Select Events Selection to allow us to filter out unnecessary processes. .NET logs very rapidly and is used by the online side.

 

By default you will have:

 

 

Generally you will not need Audit Login, Audit Logout, Existing Connection. 

 

Can be useful to leave BatchStarting and BatchCompleted so you can see how long a process takes

 

 

To filter out .NET, select Column Filters:

 

 

Add .NET%

 

 

Click Run. 

 

The trace will now pick up what you are running in Mstore (Providing it's not within the program code)

 

 

Things like reports can be run manually now in SSMS

 

 

This will then show all the report info. 

 

Trace settings can be saved for future.

text: When printing occasionally sites will get the below error: This means the till cannot find the logo set on the receipt (Or additional picture in some cases). Check which receipt design the till is using: Click on the glasses icon to check the receipt design: On the till browse to C:\ProgramData\Merac\Graphics Ensure that the picture file exists, in this case K3Logo.jpg: Sometimes the picture is not able to be opened (Will generally just show a white icon). In this instance delete it and restart Merac Updater. It should then pull the file down correctly from the server. May be named incorrectly. Ensure that within receipt designer the name is specified correctly. Occasionally the copy of the picture on the server has got corrupt. Get a working copy of the image, place it into the graphics folder and re-create till data from that till. It will then save that copy of the picture to the database.
title: Object Variable or With block variable not set - CCDocHeader
description:
When printing occasionally sites will get the below error:

 

 

This means the till cannot find the logo set on the receipt (Or additional picture in some cases).

 

Check which receipt design the till is using:

 

Click on the glasses icon to check the receipt design:

 

 

On the till browse to C:\ProgramData\Merac\Graphics

 

Ensure that the picture file exists, in this case K3Logo.jpg:

 

 

 

Sometimes the picture is not able to be opened (Will generally just show a white icon). In this instance delete it and restart Merac Updater. It should then pull the file down correctly from the server. 

 

May be named incorrectly. Ensure that within receipt designer the name is specified correctly. 

 

Occasionally the copy of the picture on the server has got corrupt. Get a working copy of the image, place it into the graphics folder and re-create till data from that till. It will then save that copy of the picture to the database.

text: If someone is not wanting to pay by DD anymore and so is not to show in the renewals process in MStore they need to cancel the authorisation. You will see there is a 'cancel authorisation' button in the DD tab of the member that needs to be clicked. This will cancel their DD authorisation and any future outstanding payments. This means these future outstanding payments will not be included in any collection batches generated, and they will not be in the DD renewal list. Example from test system: Cancel Authorisation: DD renewals ran again after cancelling the auth, no longer in the list: PLEASE NOTE cancelling the authorisation tells you that it DOES NOT EXPIRE THE MEMBERSHIP. If cancelling the DD means they are no longer a member (depends on each site and how many payments the customer has made at the time of cancellation) they need to change the expiry date themselves manually. In addition to cancelling the authorisation to be doubly sure I also change the status to A/C invalid (so they will not appear in any future collections batches). Nothing we can do if they have already submitted a batch for collection to the bank that had this person in it and shouldn't have, they would have to speak to the bank.
title: Direct Debits - Renewals showing all members
description:
If someone is not wanting to pay by DD anymore and so is not to show in the renewals process in MStore they need to cancel the authorisation.

 

You will see there is a 'cancel authorisation' button in the DD tab of the member that needs to be clicked. This will cancel their DD authorisation and any future outstanding payments. This means these future outstanding payments will not be included in any collection batches generated, and they will not be in the DD renewal list.

Example from test system:

 

 

Cancel Authorisation:

 

DD renewals ran again after cancelling the auth, no longer in the list:

 

PLEASE NOTE cancelling the authorisation tells you that it DOES NOT EXPIRE THE MEMBERSHIP. If cancelling the DD means they are no longer a member (depends on each site and how many payments the customer has made at the time of cancellation) they need to change the expiry date themselves manually.

In addition to cancelling the authorisation to be doubly sure I also change the status to A/C invalid (so they will not appear in any future collections batches). Nothing we can do if they have already submitted a batch for collection to the bank that had this person in it and shouldn't have, they would have to speak to the bank.

text: When doing a direct debit renewal via Member Wizard the final form doesn't always give the option to print the renewal letter: After trying many config options, it turns out that the system does a check to see if Microsoft office is installed. If NOT, you will get the option as below:
title: Member Wizard - Print Direct Debit letter
description:
When doing a direct debit renewal via Member Wizard the final form doesn't always give the option to print the renewal letter:

 

 

After trying many config options, it turns out that the system does a check to see if Microsoft office is installed. If NOT, you will get the option as below:

text: Some customers set their system to have passwords to expire after a certain period of time it was previously changed. The MJS account always has the same password. So to combat this, you can manually set the empPwdChanged to a date in the future, so it won't prompt for some time. SELECT * FROM Employee WHERE empUserName='MJS' BEGIN TRANSACTION UPDATE Employee SET empPwdChanged=DATEADD(Year,1,GETDATE()) WHERE empUserName='MJS' --COMMIT
title: Update empPwdChanged To Prevent Password Expired Message For MJS
description:
Some customers set their system to have passwords to expire after a certain period of time it was previously changed. The MJS account always has the same password. So to combat this, you can manually set the empPwdChanged to a date in the future, so it won't prompt for some time.

SELECT * FROM Employee
WHERE empUserName='MJS'

BEGIN TRANSACTION 
UPDATE Employee
SET empPwdChanged=DATEADD(Year,1,GETDATE())
WHERE empUserName='MJS'
--COMMIT

text: A few sites now have the newer tills with a customer display that works as a second monitor. The sites occasionally want to update the video or image that is shown on screen. If the site has a video and an image, the till will always use the video instead. To add it to the updater you will need to run the below SQL: INSERT INTO MstorePublishedFiles VALUES('cache','LineDisplay.wmv','X',GETDATE(),null,'C:\Meracdata\updatenewver\cache\LineDisplay.wmv',null) Check it shows in MStorePublishedFiles: Once added the MStore Update Files will need refreshing: If you don't know how to do this, please ask Richard or Harry. Files should only be pushed out with permission or for MStore Updates.
title: Adding a Line Display Video (or image) to Merac Updater
description:
A few sites now have the newer tills with a customer display that works as a second monitor. 


The sites occasionally want to update the video or image that is shown on screen. 

If the site has a video and an image, the till will always use the video instead. 


To add it to the updater you will need to run the below SQL:



INSERT INTO MstorePublishedFiles 

VALUES('cache','LineDisplay.wmv','X',GETDATE(),null,'C:\Meracdata\updatenewver\cache\LineDisplay.wmv',null) 


Check it shows in MStorePublishedFiles:



Once added the MStore Update Files will need refreshing:



If you don't know how to do this, please ask Richard or Harry. Files should only be pushed out with permission or for MStore Updates.

title: Live Card Enquiry Screen Not Displaying Correctly on POS
description:
If a site reports, or you notice the Live Card Enquiry screen is not displaying correctly, like below. You can update it.



You can use the below SQL to backup, delete existing, and add in the newer format file, that looks like below:



--Select * into BAKTillControls from TillControls 
--Where tclForm = 'FLIVECARDENQUIRY'
--and tclFormat = 'STDXVGA'

--begin transaction
--Delete from TillControls 
--Where tclForm = 'FLIVECARDENQUIRY'
--and tclFormat = 'STDXVGA'
--commit
